description:
My favorite vendor at the Eat Real Fest was Frozen Kuhsterd! 

I ordered the ube custard bar dipped in ube chocolate, topped with ube cake crumbs. Pure ube madness! Can't get enough ube! Every bite was amazing, and it didn't give me that weird taste after you eat something sugary. That's how I knew it was made with the highest quality ingredients! I couldn't finish the entire thing because it melted, and the chocolate shell got a little too sweet by the end-thankfully they served it to me with a plate. But it was sooo delish!
author: Megan H.

description:
I tried Frozen Custard at Undiscovered SF in August, and it was amazing! I tried the white chocolate matcha custard bar with Ube chocolate dip and dark chocolate drizzle. It was absolutely amazing! The chocolate was just the right amount of creaminess and sweetness. My friend got the coffee custard bar with dark chocolate dip, and he also enjoyed it.

I will definitely be going there to try some of the other desserts!
author: Nikki G.

description:
WOW. Best experience ever!! Jack London Square is where I was introduced to this incredible treat..!! 
If you happen upon their stand... stop!
You'll be very happy you did...
author: Mary R.

description:
While this isn't my favorite frozen custard food truck, I can't deny how yummy their custard is. It's actually pretty damn good.

I've been to this truck a few times at different Off the Grid events and festivals, and I can honestly say that their frozen custard is pretty standard. I'm pretty boring when it comes custard flavors because I usually stick to vanilla. Something about original vanilla custard just drives me wild. But for the more... "adventurous", they usually have at least 4 different custard flavors to choose from.

But the toppings?! I'll be adventurous with those! I'm a sucker for almonds and sauces on top. I would highly recommend the pairing of almonds and burnt caramel because it's simply delicious AF! A dynamic duo that will taste delicious on practically any flavor of frozen custard. If you wanna get wild and crazy with it, you can always make it into a sundae or a donut sandwich! They also sell donuts for purchase here, but I've never actually had them.

The prices are pretty comparable to any other frozen custard truck but all of those fancy toppings can add up quickly. I usually visit this truck while it's at the Pleasant Hill OTG and it never seems to be too crowded. But if you see them at Oakland First Friday's or any type of local festival, be prepared to wait. If you're a lover of frozen custard, I would give them a try.
author: Shayla B.

description: I never had Ube and the custard style popsicle. One bite and It was so divine. The flavors was so amazing. I will try the Cookie Monster next time.
author: Juan V.

description: We went to Alameda location 2 weeks ago since Frozen K. was scheduled but sadly... they were not there..
author: Regine M.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd is for sure one of the better ice cream trucks within the bay area. I got the opportunity to try it out when I was at the Live 105 BFD music festival earlier this year. Since I'm pretty much addicted to anything with s'mores, I just had to order the s'mores sundae!

Price-wise, it was a bit expensive for the quantity that was given, but it was still totally worth it. You can taste the quality within the ice cream and toppings. Each bite just kept tasting better and better. The moment I finished devouring it, I already wanted another one!

If you are ever near this truck, be sure to chase it down! Forget about counting your calories. This is perfect for your cheat days. ;)

IG: @ravenousfork
author: Tam T.

description: We were at outdoor event in Lafayette and I thought I was going to melt. This truck helped...got 2 servings of the custard with a variety of toppings... I am a fan.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd has been on my to try for ages and ages and when they showed up at my company's OTG event, I was sooooo excited! Granted, they brought with them a very limited tasting menu so my experience definitely isn't one that I can compare to a regular OTG/food truck experience.

But anyways, I tried a scoop of their toasted coconut flavor and thought it lacked a fair amount of coconut flavor despite being amazingly smooth and creamy. Towards the end, it was also just unbearably sweet. My friend hypothesized that my topping of corn flakes was to blame. But I thought the cornflakes did add a nice crunchy topping for a change in texture.

That said, I'll still be more than willing to bear the lines for a real Frozen Kuhsterd experience whenever that may manifest itself.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Ordered the s'mores with cookies and cream ice cream and it was amazing! A little pricey for the small cup but it is heaven. Perfectly roasted marshmallow with graham cracker cereal that tops this cup to perfection. Beware of how delicious it is. I highly recommend the s'mores.
author: Peanut P.

description:
STILL a must try and still a personal favorite. Not only do they have unique flavors, but they also have various ways of presenting those flavors; whether it be simply in a cup, in a donut sandwich, bread pudding style, etc, and now they also have Frozen Kuhsterd BARS. Yes that's right, bars. 

I revisted Frozen Kuhsterd on National Ice Cream day at SOMA EATS, so you bet that they had something special in store for everyone. Their normal ice cream truck sadly had no line and I couldn't understand why and then I turned around and saw their frozen kuhsterd booth selling the bars and it all made sense - everyone was trying out their new creation! My friends and I still grabbed a scoop of ice cream from their normal truck to hold us over while we wait in line for the ice cream bar hehe. We tried the red velvet cookies and cream. The way I had imagined the ice cream to be from the sound of it was that it would be red velvet ice cream with crushed cookies inside of it. However what it ended up being was vanilla ice cream with red velvet cookies crushed inside of it, so there wasn't too much red velvet flavor in it. 

We finally made our way through the line for the bars and we ordered their popular S'more's bar. I love the new ways people make s'more's! They use a vanilla ice cream bar, dip it in chocolate which acts as the adhesive for the graham cracker, then they smear marshmallow fluff on it and torch it. Sounds delicious right!? And the taste delivered! It was like eating a frozen s'more, something I would definitely have again!
author: Maleah M.

description:
Wanted to grab dessert before I left Off the Grid: Fort Mason last Friday, March 4th. Wanting to try a new place, I picked Frozen Kuhsterd. I stopped by around 8:30pm.

I ended up getting a Single scoop ($3.50) of Four barrel coffee. The frozen custard was rich and creamy with great coffee flavor. The custard is actually really dense, so I didn't need much to satisfy my sweet tooth. In fact, I didn't even finish the scoop. You can also get your custard with toppings or in sundae or sandwich form.

The cashier was nice, but when I went to pay, she moved the iPad and I accidentally the $2 tip option. Apparently I didn't have to sign for anything as it processed right after. I tried saying something, but she was already moving on to the next customer. This is partly my fault as I should have been pushier. I would have tipped a $1 anyways, so it was only a $1 more. I was more annoyed at the principle of the matter than anything else.

Good frozen custard, but watch out for the automatic credit card approval process. You may end up tipping 57% like me!
author: Elena N.

description:
Gluttony standing 10ft away alert................
I love their concept....creative frozen custard with a scoop-able experiment.
Not your ordinary boring kind of day. Starring at their truck I see this cupcake on top of custard? OOOOH and AHHH's I'm crying and really want one.

TGIF because it was CHEAT day and too bad I'm at OTG... what did I order?
oh with multiple choices of frozen kuhsterd I got four barrel coffee flavor with many choices to top it off! I'd like the burnt caramel on top and a choice of cupcake. Ooohh is that chocolate? I'll take that! Paid and stepped to the side for about 3mins, and wala! BOOM HEAVEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Thanks Frozen Kuhsterd!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Kathy V.

description:
I am not a huge fan of frozen Kuhsterd custard just because I find it pretty rich and overly creamy. However I recently tried their Filipino chocolate rice pudding dessert ("chomporado") and it was so satisfying and perfectly sweet. YUM!!

4 stars just for that - can't wait to come back!
author: Jess C.

description:
So glad I tried this food truck! It satisfies any sweet cravings.

I got the four barrel coffee flavor with burnt caramel and marshmallow toppings ($5). The dessert was large and easily shared between two people. The frozen custard was soo creamy and smooth. I thought the burnt marshmallow fluff on top was very unique. I really enjoyed it!
author: Linda X.

description: I was ecstatic to find out about the Haight location. My favorite is the Napa Sundae ( Vanilla ice cream, caramel, EVOO, and Himalayan salt). OMG! Love, Love, Love. Must try. The staff are super friendly and has great customer service.
author: Jess T.

description:
Place: it's a small store and has no seating places. It's located next to a cafe which I liked, because I was able to feed my kids (6yrs and 9yrs) some lunch before feeding them ice cream. It's located in a nice neighborhood, but parking can be problematic, but I think that's a problem wherever you go in SF. This place wasn't too far from the Golden Gate Park. We went to the Koret Children's Quarter Playground afterwards to have the kids play off the ice cream. 

Food: I'm not a big ice cream fan place and I really liked the ice cream here. I didn't try any of their specialties, but I liked how you can dip your ice cream with your choice of toppings. My kids dipped theirs in the milk chocolate and it was kind like eating a Crunch bar or Hagindaz bar of your choice. I dipped mine with the Oreo crumbs and it was scrumptious. My husband got the Thai ice cream dipped in the vanilla chocolate and it was pretty yummy. I would definitely go again just to try the other stuff on their menu.
author: Mad D.

description:
Can I just have the Thai tea and white coffee one delivered to me bi-weekly!? For a girl who doesn't like ice cream, I sure have a lot of favorites. 

The consistency of this sweet treat isn't really like ice cream. It's more so on the side of a frozen yogurt, but more stiff. Eventually it melts like ice cream does and turns into slop if you don't eat it fast enough. It's quite unique and thus that's why I like this place. 

Thai tea has strong thai tea flavor! None of that weenie light stuff. Don't you hate when you can barely taste what something is suppose to be? 

White coffee. I had to ask them what white coffee was. The kind man said it was similar to sucking on a whole ungrounded coffee bean. Wouldn't it still be brown?? o_O It's white FYI, hence the name. Well whatever that sorcery, it was my favorite out of the two, but both are pretty close!
author: Dianna C.

description:
OMG! I have Tiffany D to thank for as I saw her pic of her red velvet cupcake sundae the day before and met up with her Saturday as Frozen Kuhsterd foodie truck came to the Oakland Chinatown Streetfest! I was debating what to order as you know I am so indecisive! I actually had a scoop of their frozen custard awhile back that I wasn't very enthused. It was just okay back then.  

But my mind changed recently as I went for their cupcake sundae.  They actually have other concoctions too.  I am a changed person now!  I had the chocolate cupcake with coffee frozen custard and caramel topping.  Dang that was pure sweet heaven bliss!!! If you like ice cream and cake then this dessert is for you.  But doesn't everyone like that???

I was searching for the dessert truck the next day and was very sad they weren't around.  I felt very lucky that they came to the Streetfest and it was so very convenient for me!  If you stumble upon this truck, don't you dare pass it up bc you are missing out on one of the best desserts Ever!!! I gave it one less star bc it wasn't there Sunday or they don't come out to Sactown enough if ever???  I'm sure you can find them in the Bay fasho!!!  I better start following them on social media now!  LOL.
author: Karen K.

description:
Sorry vegans.... #alltheeggs.

If you've never had frozen custard, go, now. You are missing the bomb-diggity deliciousness of rich creamy frozen delight. Kuhsterd's got this down to a T, with the BEST Four Barrel Coffee flavor ice cream, just for the fact that it's custard. Also great is the standard Vanilla, you will NOT find a better tasting ice cream texture at any store or window. No, you don't taste the eggs--you just taste rich and creamy goodness.

If you've ever had Haagen Daaz, and can appreciate it's amazingness, do yourself a favor and get some Frozen Custard because that's like straight up clouds in a cup o'custard.
author: Nerissa C.

description: Tried this cute food truck for the first time at Off the Grid. I ordered one of their frozen Popsicles with a vanilla base. I just wish I remembered the name of it, but it was a variety of red velvet, chocolate fudge, and I think cereal dipped on it. SO MUCH GOODNESS!! I was worried it'd be like having diabetes on a stick, but surprisingly, the ice cream wasn't overly sugary, and the cooled fudge made it a super soft and warm treat......my mouth is watering.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Hi, I'm Olaf and I like warm hugs!!!!

Okay, so it's not that Frozen.

This is frozen custard.

I'm really liking their Thai iced tea and their coffee flavor here.

With the check in, which they don't even check I just mentioned Yelp, I got a free sticker and a free topping.

So I settled on their coffee custard with the condensed milk topping. So basically it tasted like a Vietnamese coffee drink.

Let it snow!
author: Jack R.

description:
Had an interesting experience tying frozen custard for the first time at Off the Grid Fort Mason. Though prices were pretty steep for would be ice cream, what really makes me appreciate this tent is that the flavors are so unique. For example, I got the Napa Sundae and I still taste the olive oil with sea salt in my mouth. My favorite however is the coffee with oreo crumbles.

Overall, a bit too pricey, but still an experience worth checking out. I think it's a great addition to OTG and hope it stays for a while!
author: Bryan W.

description:
The company I work for hired Frozen Kuhsterd to host dessert for our entire staff, roughly around 200 employees. I was very excited at first as it was a nice and sunny, but not too hot, but perfect for a frozen treat. The FK staff did a good job at pumping the frozen yogurt out in a timely manner with the mass amount of people waiting for some creamy goodness.

They offered the following flavors: Vanilla Bean, Four Barrel Coffee, Chocolate, and Burnt Caramel. I sampled a few and they were not too bad, but as a few other Yelpers, pointed out, they were pretty sweet. I am not a frozen dessert snob, but I really could not tell the difference between FK's offerings and a large tub of Dryers from the grocery store. I do not mean to bash on them, but I was fairly disappointed they did not offer some of the odd ball flavors that Yelpers were posting pictures of on FK's page. As for toppings, they brought along some crushed almonds, oreos, corn flakes, and sprinkles. Not too creative, but not too terrible either as most expect that at any ice cream or gelato shop.

I would love to sample some of the other flavors if I get the chance in the future as they may much better than what I experienced today.
author: Ryan A.

description:
I'm not sure why I haven't grown an obsessive fondness for frozen custard. After all, I'm the one who orders caramel flan for dessert at a Mexican restaurant when others order churros. Custard pie was my favorite as a child. Not apple, not blueberry, but custard with the nutmeg sprinkled on top with a side of Cool Whip. So why was I not overjoyed when I saw this truck at the Friday Night Market at Civic Center? I think it's because I didn't grow up with it like Midwesterners did. You wouldn't buy it in the frozen food section of Jewel Supermarket. You had to get it fresh at a shop with a spigot big enough to let that intensely dense cream come out in a slow ooze.

You can tell there's a ton of butter fat and egg yolks in frozen custard to satisfy the high-risk sweet tooth. Founder Jason Angeles learned to make the real thing at a two-week crash course in St. Louis, recruited three buddies as partners and became an immediate hit among the hipsters at various food truck congregations in the Bay Area. And why not? They serve all the cool-sounding creations like the $6.50 Dynamo Donut Sandwich; the $6 Napa Style Sundae with burnt caramel, Himalayan salt and EVOO; and the absurd self-indulgence of the $16 "FK Your Diet" Sundae which sounds like your basic kitchen sink (photo: http://bit.ly/1xdFjop).

Jamie W. and I were feeling the need for a bit of dessert and decided to try the $6.50 S'mores Sundae which allowed us a choice of our own frozen custard flavor, two layers of honey graham crackers, chocolate syrup and toasted mini-marshmallows on top (photo: http://bit.ly/1Fzf9Oc). Although they offered temptations like White Coffee, Strawberry Basil and Thai Tea, both of us felt Vanilla Bean made the most sense given all the sweetness in that cup. I must be getting old because I found the concoction just way too sweet to enjoy fully with the best part the toasted marshmallows since they did evoke my days as a Cub Scout in front of the campfire with the scoutmaster leaning toward me and...uh, never mind. Somebody hand me that blowtorch.

SUNDAE - 3 stars...lots of sweet ingredients that ended up being too overpowering for me but hey, to each his own
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...party truck!
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...they put it together pretty quickly considering the toasting needed for the marshmallows
TOTAL - 3 stars...audience for these sweets appears to be a lot younger than me..I just suggest they see a dentist afterward
author: Ed U.

description:
I like it when you do it right thurrrrr. Right thurr!! 

Got me some of that donut bread pudding sundae and went straight to frozen delight heaven. 

Ohhhh boy!! This truck is explosive!! Don't be hesitant, dive in. These desserts are hitting heavy on the sexiness Richter scale. Worth every calorie.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: I give this place 5 stars. Jason the owner has great customer service and I like the fact that he uses organic ingredients.
author: PremiumShotz P.

description: Who doesn't like super rich, creamy ice cream sandwiched between a variety of carb-filled desserts? Frozen Kuhsterd's creations are decadent and ideal for those who like their sweets combined with even more sweets. You have desserts combined with other desserts that are dessert-flavored - I had a red velvet cookies and cream custard sandwiched between a creme brulee donut with condensed milk. There was a lot going on in each bite (in a good way) - red velvet cake, cookies and cream, the burnt caramel and vanilla custard of creme brulee, sweet fluff of the donut, and the light glaze of condensed milk. I could feel my heart start to race from all the sugar, and it was glorious.
author: Hali M.

description:
Nom Nom FACTOR ALERT!  
I got the donut bread pudding with frozen custard. I was very pleased. The donut was ON POINT full of cinaminny GOODNESS and what brought it all together was the frozen custard  it was the perfect amount of sweet that wouldn't make your teeth hurt.  I am definitely coming back! The customer service was great, very nice man taking my order.
author: Claudia T.

description: Stopped by for the Eat Real Festival to get something cold to eat since it was SO HOT that day. My friend and I decided to split the Kouign Amman Sandwich ($8), which was rich and decadent. This is definitely quite the hefty dessert, and although I enjoyed it, I would prefer just the kusterd in a cone/cup versus in a kouign amman. However, I'd recommend trying this once if you're a kouign amman fan!
author: Amy D.

description: Brownie points for trying something super weird - ie. virgin olive oil in ice cream o_o It was interesting, but I don't know if I'd go and get that ice cream flavor (napa sundae) again.
author: Belinda L.
Liana B.

description:
Not nearly as good tonight @OTG Cupertino as I remembered from Bacon Fest 2 years back. Scoop of Four Barrel Coffee frozen custard was a little icy, left a fine-grain texture on my tongue, and lacked coffee flavor.

Very disappointing.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Why have I not gone here sooner?! I've seen this truck on various occasions but never tried it until coming to the Eat Real Festival. Not many places do custard or if they do it tastes too much like yogurt but Frozen Kuhsterd knows their ish when it comes to making a great custard!! 

I'm one of those types of people that is scared to try new things so I didn't want to try their "different" flavors like cookie butter or cereal milk lol maybe next time. I got the vanilla bean and topped it off with burnt caramel sauce, OMG!!! It was to die for!! I'm picky with caramel but that was the best and I honestly could have had that alone lol but the custard was wonderful too, it was creamy and rich and I would take that over regular ice cream any day. Now whenever I see their truck there's no way I'll be able to pass it by cuz it's that bomb.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd is one of the food trucks that I had my eye on.  Noticed that they were on the schedule for Off The Grid Alameda and Off The Grid Pleasanton.   So, I went to both places in order to try them out.

At Alameda, my wife and I each ordered a different sundae.

Champorado Sundae with Vanilla Bean Frozen Custard was my wife's choice.  I was not too impressed with this combination.  Turns out that I like Champarado better without frozen custard.  My wife liked the sundae better than I.  (3.5 stars)

Donut Bread Pudding Sundae with Vanilla Bean Frozen Custard was my selection.  Enjoyed it better than wifey's order.  I do not know if they make their donuts or someone else makes it for them.  Was not crazy about the donut,  The Vanilla Bean Frozen Custard was delicious, though. (3.5 stars for this sundae)

In Pleasanton, only I had ordered something from their truck.

Napa Style Sundae for $6 includes Vanilla Bean frozen custard, burnt caramel, extra virgin olive oil, and Himalayan sea salt.  Was intrigued by the flavor combination.  Wifey did not care for it.  I, on the other hand, thoroughly enjoyed every spoonful!  Yummyness!!!  (4.5 stars)

In the future, I probably will stick to just their frozen custard flavors and not have any sundaes. They only have 4 flavors available each time, and they rotate the flavors.  Hopefully, I will catch them at times when they have some of their erotic flavors available!
author: PatrickJ T.

description:
I've had Frozen Kuhsterd a few times, most recently at Spark Social. The Thai Iced Tea was spot on. Add some five star caramel sauce and a horchata cupcake (a little dry, but forgivable), and it makes for the perfect indulgent delight. 

Definitely go for a sundae or at least one topping!
author: Cristina S.

description:
Money can't buy happiness, but it can buy Frozen Kuhsterd.. and that's basically the same thing. ;)

They're at different places every day, so check their website or their twitter to see #WheresFK. I had the pleasure of catching them at the SF Friday Night Market. The Night Market itself was pretty lackluster, so the only place we got food from was Frozen Kuhsterd. Getting dessert before a real dinner... why not?

Frozen custard is ice cream that is made with a higher egg yolk content, making the ice cream creamier and denser. They make a bunch of different flavors, but only serve four on a given day. We got a scoop of Vanilla Bean and a scoop of Thai Tea with condensed milk and corn flakes. It was basically happiness served in a cup. Although it was freezing already, I couldn't stop scooping more ice cream into my mouth! 

1 scoop for $3.50 or 2 scoops for $5. Each topping is an additional 50 cents, but you get a free topping if you check into Yelp! So what are you waiting for? Go get FKed!
author: Christine S.

description: Without question, the best ice cream and dessert place in the bay area!! Stop thinking and start heading over there now!
author: Joel S.

description:
They came out for Off The Grid: Great Mall. I was at work and I already had some food from the other food trunks that was around them. And I wanted to get desert. 

My manager and I wanted desert. He kept it simple with a one scoop vanilla bean with Cinnamon Toast Crunch while I got the s'more sundae with chocolate ice cream. 

I devour it. It was so good.

I would come back to them if they come back out for off the grid.
author: Kristy A.

description:
These guys were at the Yelp Oakland zoo family event and they were super nice.  

We tried samples of their vanilla bean and coffee kuhsterd and we really enjoyed them.  I've got to say that I like the kuhsterd better than ice cream!  

We've got to take a trip down to their storefront soon!
author: Veronica A.

description:
I was drawn to the blue truck with the anthropomorphic dessert cup logo. I'm not sure what 'West Coast style frozen custard' is supposed to be, but I was curious to try.
They have a plethora of flavors, including the classic and familiar, some alcoholic, as well as some very strangely intriguing ones, like White Rabbit candy, Avocado, and Miso. Even their toppings are unique, like tapioca balls and ramen. 
It seems like their trucks serve only a few flavors at a time, which makes sense. It wouldn't be the best use of their resources if they loaded up dozens of gallons of different flavors into a truck all at once.
It seems like Cereal Milk is very popular. I tried the one from Momofuku and while it was good, it wasn't amazing. So I got a double scoop of the Four Barrel Coffee & Thai Iced Tea for $5. Two generously sized mounds of custard plopped into a plastic cup. It was deliciously sweet and creamy, like I thought it would be. To me, both had an interesting gritty texture, probably from ground coffee beans and tea leaves(?).

It's cool that they have partnered with several local coffee & dessert shops and created some very decadent sundaes. It seems like they come up with new combinations all the time.

Kids Scoop: $2.50
Single: $3.50
Double: $5
Sundaes: ~$6-$7

I'd be interested in trying out other flavors, especially White Rabbit candy, or Ube, or Coffee Mint Mojito.
I enjoyed it, but I'm still left wondering what makes frozen custard different from ice cream? Also, what makes this custard 'West coast style'?
author: Joy W.

description:
This sundae treat on a Friday was royalty! 
Frozen Khusterd didn't disappoint. Vanilla layered Icecream over burnt caramel, splashed with EVOO topped with melted marsh mallow...Heaven was here on earth for the few minutes it took to devour it!
author: Dee R.

description:
I tried Frozen Kuhsterd for the first time recently and can say I'm a new fan :) I saw on the OTG Facebook page that they were going to be offering White Rabbit one day and knew I had to give it a try since I absolutely love the candy!

They hadn't officially opened for business when I arrived but they were very friendly and answered my questions as well as let me try some samples.

I sampled their White Rabbit and it absolutely tasted like the candy. I was very impressed! When it came time to order I ended up adding burnt caramel as a topping. The burnt caramel was good, but it took away from the flavor so next time I would consider going topping-less to really savor the flavor of the frozen custard.

I follow them on social media now as I am eagerly awaiting the next time they will be offering White Rabbit, or any other flavor that might tickle my fancy. They've got sundaes and other goodies too which I may just have to try some time :)

Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get a fee topping!
author: Carnita M.

description:
On any given tuesday the local Off the Grid showcases several food trucks, this one being one of the better dessert trucks that I have had.

There ever changing flavors of ice cream always amaze me when I stop by there truck, yesterdays options which I never see anywhere was white rabbit (as a flavor for ice cream), and few others, everything that I had here was good, primarily go for the bread pudding which is semi warm making all the ice cream around it melt, 

Served in a medium sized cup, bottom small top wide, so you can access the bottom if needed, bread pudding, topped with white rabbit flavored ice cream, let me just say JESUS CHRIST this is good... AMEN!!!! bread pudding is slightly dense, easy to cut with a spoon and delicious with every bite, I do recommend the white rabbit ice cream to pair with the bread pudding 

I will be back again and order other items but for now that bread pudding is the way to go

bread pudding with ice cream *****
service ***** smiles from all staff
price $
ambiance **** food truck no place to sit, bring your own seat, table, canopy =)
author: Clarence A.

description: Love their Napa Style Sundae - Scoop of Vanilla Bean frozen custard with a bottom layer of burnt caramel, topped with Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Himalayan Pink Salt. Bomb! At $6 each, they are a little pricey but so worth it!
author: Veronica C.

description:
Don't forget to check in for the free topping! Ran into this by chance while we were out looking for lunch. There were a couple of food trucks out in Foster City and I couldn't resist getting some dessert. One scoop proved to be enough for me; it's really filling.

Green tea strawberry topped with oreo crumbs: not that much green tea, more so strawberry. It was disappointing to find no hints of matcha. Otherwise, it was a nice treat.
author: James N.

description:
In love with their cereal milk flavored custard! You know it's good when I come back for more! It reminds me of the cereal milk soft serve at Momofuku Milk Bar in NYC. It tastes just like the leftover milk you slurp on after you eat all your cereal. They soak their custard in corn flakes to give it the nostalgic cereal milk flavor. I've also tried their four barrel latte custard. Not a fan.

They currently run in a food truck, but hopefully, they'll have a permanent store.
author: Helen C.

description:
7/14/15 (update):  Much better "ice cream" this time around, compared to my last try of their vanilla, which was icy.  I call it ice cream cause that's what it tastes like.  Not the smooth, rich, frozen custard I make at home anyway...

1. Li Hing Pineapple Sundae $6.00: Good flavor mix but somewhat simple.  More simple than other offerings I've had of theirs.  No sauce as far as I can tell.  Just marinated pineapple, whipped cream, and a sprinkling of the "Li Hing" powder, which kinda tastes like the Mexican sweet chili spice they use on various dried fruits.  I got their Mexican Chocolate for the ice cream--it turned out to be a good match for the Mexican-like spices.  5/10

2. Mexican Chocolate "custard" [not]: As mentioned previously, doesn't taste like custard.  But at least in this case, it's good ice cream (I can't say the same for their other variations.)  It's smooth (great) and definitely has a strong Mexican chocolate taste.  Very good.  I think this is the strongest ice cream I've tried from them yet.  8/10

3/5

#truck #icecream #frozencustard #sundae
author: Dean C.

description:
If you want some smooth cream in your mouth that will get you FK'd in more ways than one, you gotta get some of my personal faves: Thai tea, Burnt Caramel, and Vanilla Bean. But if you can't choose just one, you might as well get a sundae [and] "FK your diet" that gives you sampling of a few of their delectable frozen kuhsterds.

But I do want to put this out there. Jason, the owner puts a whole lot of thought into his frozen kuhsterds.I remember before he even got his truck and was still carting his flavors, how particular he was with his flavor profiles. He held this taste testing event in San Francisco simply to choose the best "vanilla". All of us were blind folded and remember all of them were so good! This just goes to show how much he cares about his product and those that he serves. 

Great frozen Kuhsterd, great team.
author: The Fuzzies S.

description: huge fan! from food truck to cater to the store! i love them!
author: Jan H.

description:
FK is the king of Asian flavors.

I had the black sesame custard one night and was hooked. I was eating dinner elsewhere one night and they offered me ice cream: green tea or black sesame? 
Well, duh I went for black sesame since I was craving FK.

ugh. waste of calories.

That black sesame ice cream was garbage. I've had a few FK flavors now: vanilla, white chocolate, avocado, black sesame, Thai tea and DAYEEM! My favorite is definitely the black sesame, but the Thai tea is so good. It is SPOT ON. You know what the avocado custard tastes like? Vietnamese coffee shop avocado shakes. You know which ones I'm talkin about, the Viet coffee shops that serve it to you with the extra milk on the side *wink wink* 

Anyway, for my Yelp buddies and FB friends who have been asking me where the heck I keep eating these FK sundaes at every single week, *LIKE* the Frozen Kuhsterd Facebook page to keep track of their whereabouts and see the menu! 

... and yea, I know. I have a problem. All good. I love bad b1tchezzzzz that's my fuggin problem... and I love FK that's my fuggin problem. SO FUGGIN GOOD


P.S. When they have the Kouign-amann sammie available, ORDER IT.
author: Susy C.

description:
This review is long overdue, but sometimes I like that I may forget to write reviews, and then revisit a place after awhile and still get wowed.  So the first time I visited the Frozen Kuhsterd truck was a few years ago at SOMA Streat.  We actually shared a scoop of the milk tea flavor.  And everyone who knows me knows I don't do milk tea because I only like the fruity Americanized teas, but this was so good.  It had a teeny subtle tea flavor, and the milky flavor worked well the creaminess of the custard.  It was thick enough and not too sweet.  We also got to talk to the guys for a few minutes, they are so sweet!  

Flash forward to last month at OTG Serramonte.  We just like a slew of other people still wanted dessert even when it was freezing cold.  So we waited in line for dessert.  But there were so many choices..I'm not gonna lie, I was tempted to get the cronut ice cream sandwich or a silvana ice cream sandwich.  But we kept it simple with a scoop of cookie butter custard.  It tasted just like the awesome Trader Joe's cookie butter, and was nice and creamy.  The single scoop is huge too, so you definitely get your money's worth here.  Maybe next time we'll be adventurous and get toppings, but the custard here doesn't need it at all, because it's great on its own.  

Get some of their custard when you see these guys trucks and you won't be disapointed.  What if it's freezing out?  You still won't be disappointed for sure, because the satisfaction in your stomach will outweigh the cold.
author: Cat C.

description:
They were the MAIN reason I showed up at Sunnyvale's 2nd Annual Fry's Food Truck Event and I'm sooo glad I got to experience it. THEIR CUSTARD IS THE BOMB!!!! The guys behind the truck were super friendly and they let us sample their custard before we made our decision on what to order.

What I swallowed:

COFFEE CUSTARD: I don't even DRINK COFFEE but this ish was the BOMB! YUMMMYYY!!!

MILK CEREAL CUSTARD: YUMMYYYY! WTH! MORE PLEASE! 

I completely forgot what the second one was.. but I remember once I tasted it.. it was a hard decision to decide what to order..

What I ended up ordering:

MAPLE BACON DONUT SANDWICH with MILK CEREAL CUSTARD and BURNT CARAMEL SAUCE: If I could SLATHER this thing all over my body I would.. I couldn't stop eating this! I was very sad when my dish came to an end. I keep dreaming of the damn custard.. it's THAT GOOD!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/frozen-kuhsterd-san-francisco-3?select=ys0CRv-iRRySKs2l-vIOxg#WZdHNL9F0VWPRGLf1GQcbA

On my way home from the event, I looked over at my friend and we both agreed we shoulda ordered some more custard to-go. Dang.
author: Vivian A.

description:
Over the past couple of years, I have gone to this truck around 7 times. Four of those seven times, they were sold out of what I wanted (even though it was only 30 minutes after they opened). Twice, they weren't ready to serve certain items.

They seem to be either overstaffed or short staffed and unprepared for business.

They've upped their prices. Six dollars for a tiny scoop of frozen custard is a bit much. Their cupcakes were tiny and on the stale side when I've tried them.

I need to stay away from this truck.
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Grabbed a cup at the How Weird street fair and it was delicious.  They have a number of delicious flavors.  I opted for a coffee mix with Oreo cookies on top.

Initially I had good intentions and planned to share with friends.  After feeding each of them a bite, I devoured the rest of it (whoops...).  Absolutely delectable, I look forward to grabbing another cup soon!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Off the grid: Cupertino ~4/21/15

I'd love to give this place a 5...but once again the customer service was just plain RUDE.

*Jason, the owner of Frozen Kuhsterd is a very nice and honest seller. From my last review, he addressed the issue, and gave me ice cream that was of Frozen Kuhsterd's size standard. I gave it a second chance, and was impressed by the normal and generous size. Very friendly/professional, and handles his business well.*

However, the customer service was straight up rude and mean today. They called me out as "Oh. YOU were the girl that wrote the BAD review." Okay, so double scoop is on the house, but the employees decide to use it as a leeway to complain and humiliate me for writing such a bad review? Isn't this backfiring? It caused a mini-commotion among the customers, and it was embarrassing! And then the guy, I don't remember his name, tells me that that the small scoop that I had was normal, and it shouldn't have been "an issue" and etcetera, claiming that he worked there for so long and that tiny tiny scoop is normal, since they apparently "don't serve anything bigger, it's ALWAYS been this SMALL". No, it has not always been that small; it's obvious from yelp pictures, personal experience, and word of mouth.

***He tried to put the blame on me, and nagged at me for writing a review that was bad, saying that it wasn't their fault the scoop was tiny and defending himself/FK, even though I came in happy and didn't even inquire about the past incident.
***Very Unprofessional and Whiny***
The employee kept addressing me as the "girl who gave a bad review", and this is no way to treat a customer. How you treat me/service/food/etc is how I rate honestly...and you should not be complaining...other people review honestly too, good or bad.

 I think by me going there to get the  scoop, it should have been a happy thing; since last time the scoop was considerably very small, so it would have made up for it, but instead you guys lash out at me. Not cool. Even though I appreciate the ice cream, the customer service is pretty bad. 

However the owner is very generous, and does care about customers, and quality of ice cream!
author: Julie A.

description:
I'm a one man kinda woman.

Well, that's until a little man in blue came into my life.

His name is Mr. Frozen Kuhsterd and he's the BEST I've ever had. PERIOD. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zvqoeNxrfZKqbUFlNiKplg?select=ys0CRv-iRRySKs2l-vIOxg#Bjd4gffkw5ViLGesRvXdUA

He comes in different flavors but vanilla custard is my favorite, perfectly scooped on top of his beezie, Ms. Butter Love. I guess you can say, I had a menage a trios. My first ever. *Giggles*

Butter Love's Pear & Grape Pie A La Mode w/ Vanilla Frozen Custard & Burnt Caramel Sauce ($7)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zvqoeNxrfZKqbUFlNiKplg?select=ys0CRv-iRRySKs2l-vIOxg#ys0CRv-iRRySKs2l-vIOxg
Luscious chunks of sweetly tender pear and grapes tucked inside a sinfully rich and insanely flaky buttery crust with an incredibly mouth-watering crumble made me tingle. Thickly dense and deliciously aromatic creamy vanilla custard made my body quiver. Together, Mr. Frozen Kuhsterd and Ms. Butter Love made each one of my toes curl, both eyes roll to the back of my head and made my heart skip a beat.

Pure, subliminal ECSTASY.

Bite after bite, Mr. NSS glared at me with a big kid pouty face about to go kick rocks.

Mr. NSS: "You look like you just had multiple orgasms; I wish I can do that to you."

Me: "There, there Snookums, you may want to try for ONE first."

OTHER NOTES: 
*Very helpful and friendly staff.
*Over 40 flavors; 3 available each day (Cereal Milk is most popular).
*$3.50 single scoop, $5 double scoop, $6 sundae, and $7 pie parfait/a la mode.
*Partners with Boba Guys (for sundaes) http://www.yelp.com/biz/boba-guys-san-francisco-2#hrid:XW2eKfPr7WU3DUQkdWtzbA and Butter Love Bakeshop (for pie parfaits/a la mode) http://www.yelp.com/biz/butter-love-bakeshop-san-francisco
*They're at the SoMa StrEat Food Park every Saturday from 11 AM - 9 PM http://www.yelp.com/biz/soma-streat-food-park-san-francisco.
*Also available at Suika Bento Café on Wednesday-Saturday 6 PM - 10 PM (extended hours not listed on Yelp) http://www.yelp.com/biz/suika-bento-cafe-san-francisco#query:Frozen%20Kuhsterd.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Disclosure: These 4star reviews are soooo irritating! You don't like it because it's creamy?! That's the point of "Custard". I'm so sorry there are so many dummies out there, but this is Yelp and it attracts the loud and stupid, but really bumping it down a star affects the positive visibility of the business, they're better off without your 4star review. 5 or bust. Anyway. Just saying. If you're looking for Fro-yo there are plenty of places on every corner. 


This is the only dessert I ever need again. I didn't see the FK your diet sundae or I would have had it! I love everything they offer and want all of it every time. I had the donut breadpudding sundae with burnt caramel and vanilla bean khustard. I want one of these permanently in Alameda. Omg! Heavan. This and some Korean Fusion and I can die happy. Seriously eat my dessert first errrrrrry time this truck rolls through. God Bless Khustard!
author: Stardust N.

description: The best excuse for a cheat day.  Their vanilla  is not like your basic vanilla ice cream.  My favorite is their burnt caramel. Only the best toppings as well.
author: Gin S.

description: LOVED the Four Barrel Coffee and Thai ice tea flavors, which we sampled before going all in. The scoops were very generous, and two scoops will only set you back $5. The also have sundaes that feature their vanilla bean flavor, but where's the fun with that?
author: CQ N.

description:
My friends and I trekked through the streets of SF looking for this truck. Yelp directions led us astray, and we ended up on the wrong side of town... but we couldn't give up as we had already put in so much effort!

When we finally arrived, I ordered a scoop of bourbon kettle corn with burnt caramel. It was really tasty, and the flavor was unique! I could actually taste the bourbon! It was a little on the sweet side, especially with the caramel, but it was still good. It had great texture too - denser than your typical ice cream, but still smooth and creamy. 

Also tried some of the four barrel coffee custard - less sweet with a very strong coffee flavor, perfect for coffee lovers.

Great customer service!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Okay Thai Tea was amazing. It tasted exactly how the drink tastes and that's all I could ask for. I do want to try one of their special concoctions next time but thai tea was perfect for my first time. 

I tried this at Off The Grid: Serramonte and the flavors they had that day were Vanilla Bean, Thai Tea, Mint Cookies and Cream, and Cookie Butter. 

Side note: I'm still so confused as to what "frozen custard" is. It looked and tasted like ice cream so I don't mind at all!
author: Amanda L.

description: It was a hot, blistering 4th of July at the Island Reggae Festival at Santa Clara Fairgrounds and I was tipsy, dehydrated and HANGRY! While there were plenty of food trucks, all had insanely long lines and I was about to throw a bf if I had to wait to get some food. Thank the lord baby Jesus that I decided to angrily walk around until I stumbled upon this diamond in the rough. There was no wait and service was quick. I originally wanted the S'mores sundae but they were out so I settled for the Napa Style sundae. And OH EM GEE, so thankful that I did because it was deliciousss! Who knew EVOO, Himalayan sea salt, and burnt caramel would go so well with ice cream?! The vanilla custard ice cream was unbelievably creamy and melted like buttah. This place is AWESOME and I wish they had a location in SJ.
author: Jenny O.

description:
Finally, an ice cream type truck! d:

No really, it's quite good. Custard itself is creamy and lightly sweet. It's a good idea for a base in a frozen dessert and the guys who make it, make it well. 

Their menu is pretty interesting. Definitely some Asian inspiration going on in there. I was very curious for the boba sundae but ultimately wanted the Thai tea custard. But it was sold out. 

So, I got the vanilla custard with house made chocolate sauce and cinnamon toast crunch. I got a small so that was $3.50 + 50 cents per topping. Kind of pricey, but the quality is there.

Their product is advertised as creamy and dense with a smooth finish which I can now vouch for. I liked the texture and the flavor overall.

My co-worker got the pear pie sundae thing which was crazy good. I shied away from that because it was $7, but it's worth a try.

Overall good truck. I've been wanting to try it again ever since.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Yumo!
Their Irish coffee custard is delicious!!
The guys who run it are really cool too!
author: Ashley G.

description:
It's no secret that some like it thick for a soft landing.  At Frozen Kuhsterd, you can have it thick for sure but don't expect a soft landing.  This dense stiff serving of frozen goodness is sweet, creamy, and silky smooth as you allow a spoonful of Kuhsterd happiness to slowly melt in your mouth.  People like Elite Ringo M. aka 'Food Kid fAAt City' and friends hunt down this truck with an adventurous sense of foodies' excitement and anxiously wait long lines just to do a little bit of Akinyele and put it in their mouths.  If Crystal Johnson came by with Akinyele we'd definitely see her singing 'Put It In Your Mouth' with a whole new set of lyrics:

Now you can lick it, you can lip it, you can taste it
I'm talkin every spoonful don't you waste it
Baby, come line up, so FK can fill our cups
It's frigid lickin good, and I'm wishin Kuhsterd would
Have an extra truck so the line can move fast
I'm always sprung about to order after 30 mins passed
Just eatin me a Kuhsterd
The way FK dish it out they pack such a tasty treat
And I can eat it up
I put it in my mouth
Put it in your mouth
I said your salivating mouth
I said your Kuhsterd fiendin mouth
And we could just eat it up

You know which one I would put in my mouth? In my FK lovin mouth?  I'd take down that Four Barrel Coffee with Cornflakes for that crunchy texture to go with that beautifully smooth custard.  It's rich but you won't find it hiding any Benjis.  Somehow, this Frozen Kuhsterd has the power to make you leave feeling like a million bucks after taking up your time and a few bucks from your pockets.  Impressive.
author: Colin M.

description: Tried them out at the large sactomofo event.  I ordered the regular cronut with the cinnamon toast crunch custard and the cereal on top.  It was good and didn't have to wait that long, but they are a little pricey.  I would definitely try them out again.  Too bad they are not usually in Sacramento and only bay area.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd at Eat Real Festival 2012- Vanilla3 (cubed), Blue Bottle Coffee and "Cinnamon Toast Crunch". Cinnamon Toast Crunch is my favorite kid's cereal...now in frozen custard form. That's hot.  Sundaes $5 - Boba Guys' Sundae - scoop of choice, plus condensed milk, choice of boba OR almond jelly. Bacon Waffle a la mode -Liege bacon waffle topped with burnt caramel and scoop of choice. FK Breakfast - scoop of choice topped with condensed milk and choice of cereal. Halo Halo - Flan Flan ta-tas's leche flan topped with scoop of choice, ube and crispy rice. o-m-g, to die for. These guys are sundae geniuses. 

At Yelp East Bay Beerwalk Empire event - Dark Chocolate Stout and Honey Graham Cracker. Tried both. Dark Chocolate Stout was my favorite because it wasn't super chocolatey like chocolate ice cream and not overly sweet. 

Frozen Kuhsterd is as addictive as ...falling in love. :)
author: Liv K.

description:
We ordered Frozen Kuhsterd for the night before the wedding celebration.
The ice cream is too sweet and the taste is not impressive. The staff wasn't bad but wasn't too helpful.

Next celebration I would order another company .
author: Lilly S.

description: Delicious! Tried the Napa Style Sundae and was pleasantly surprised by the way the olive oil complimented the ice cream. Also tried a cupcake sundae with a vanilla cupcake with vanilla ice cream and strawberries--a yummy take on a strawberry shortcake. I'd definitely try them again to explore their other combos and flavors!
author: Susan G.

description: I tried this "frozen custard" at Foster City's off the grid.  This is not authentic frozen custard. I grew up in The Midwest, home to frozen custard. This was very icy ice cream.  I was extremely disappointed.  I would definitely not recommend it.
author: Karen P.

description:
This truck is pretty awesome. I've had frozen custard from quite a few places and trucks, but I don't think I've ever seen as many options as this place. Lots and lots of toppings to choose from and also sundaes too!

I just wanted a light dessert and got a single scoop with no toppings. I was most curious about the Cereal Milk flavor. Like, "Noo, it can't be. Is it gonna taste exactly how I think it's gonna taste?". And yeah, it tasted exactly how I thought it was gonna taste. The first taste I could distinguish was that of pure cold milk, but then the sweetness immediately hits. It's literally just like a creamy frozen version of the milk leftover after a bowl of honey nut cheerios or something. The texture is lighter than other frozen custards I've tried. It's a bit more soft serve-y, but still very creamy and packed with flavor. 

Yeah, pretty awesome indeed! Would love to come back and try other flavors with toppings next time. I saw that they also let you sample flavors before you order, so definitely taking advantage of that too!
author: Karen T.

description:
Hello, my name is Clarice and I have a serious case of "hungry eyes" (literal English translation of a Filipino phrase which means what you see look so delectable that your appetite becomes exaggerated to the point that your perceived hunger becomes greater than your actual hunger, resulting in a lot of leftover food). I usually am able to keep this "affliction" a secret, but Frozen Kuhsterd's FK Your Diet Sundae proved too much of an opponent that I had no choice but allow the hungry eyes to win.

I have been following their truck on Twitter for a while now but for one reason or another, our paths have never crossed until they made the fateful decision to be part of Off The Grid: Pleasant Hill, which is near me, at a time when I can actually make it. At last, thought I, here is the chance to see if they are worth the hype. 

Their flavors that day were Vanilla Bean, Four Barrel Coffee, Cereal Milk, and Thai Tea. I was already pondering getting the Four Barrel Coffee and Thai Tea while willing my curiosity about the other two flavors to go away, when I saw they offer Halo-Halo Sundae. For a Filipino girl like me who keeps seeing halo-halo posts on her FB feed for the past two months, that was really a delight! Forget getting just two scoops, I wanted a Halo-Halo Sundae. But of course, my eyes simply had to look at everything and rested on "FK Your Diet Sundae - all of our flavors and toppings with your choice of Mission Mini Cupcake and Doughnut." I looked at their selections of cupcakes and doughnuts and they had NUTELLA and salted caramel, respectively. 

I am an entitled girl who believes she can have it all, and by golly will I have them all. I like frozen custard. I like cupcakes. I like Nutella. I like doughnuts. I like salted caramel. I shall have frozen custard, cupcake, and doughnuts. I shall eat them all! Woe betide anyone who tries to tell me about calorie count and such health stuff. So FK Your Diet Sundae is what I finally settled on.

I was awestruck the moment I saw the sheer monstrosity that my hungry eyes made me order. I was the recipient of the hateful "How can you be slim and eat all these frozen custard?" glances (Hungry eyes, people, I order considerably more than I can eat). I was stopped by a few people so they can take a picture of my frozen treat. I was overwhelmed. But I ordered it and I stood by my order.

So, the frozen custard. Oh. My. Goodness. How did I exist on this Earth and not have had this amazingness a part of my life heretofore? The custard is smooth and rich, creamy and not overwhelmingly sweet. It is difficult to decide which one of the flavors that day was my favorite, but I can tell you that mixing all four flavors together in one bite was heaven. The Nutella cupcake was moist and delicious, and the salt from the salted caramel doughnut counterbalanced all the sweetness going on in my palate. Their FK Your Diet Sundae may have been a monster, but I want that monster to hide under my bed so I can have it for midnight snack. I want that monster to be my friend.

I did not finish the sundae, but I am a certified Frozen Kuhsterd fan. Till next week at OTG: Pleasant Hill (yup, I know you will be there June 11th and 25th)! Your Halo-Halo Sundae and I have a date!
author: Clarice O.

description:
The cool/risky thing about these guys is that you don't know what flavors and sundaes they're going to have when you visit - some interesting, some traditional, but all very creative. The menu seems to differ from day to day, but thankfully they were handing out samples when I came, so that was helpful in making my decision.  

I visited them (or more accurately, was on a MISSION to find them) at their tent at Maker Faire. Their prices were a tad higher than usual due to vendor fees, so a single scoop was $4, while a double scoop was $6, and toppings were 50 cents each, including burnt caramel, sprinkles, chocolate and strawberry sauces, etc. I ordered a single scoop of cookies and cream (a safe flavor for me) with chocolate sauce. The flavor of the chocolate sauce was a little off but it wasn't a big deal because the frozen custard was still good! I sampled the cereal milk flavor, but it might be an acquired taste. My boyfriend got the donut sundae, and they had some interesting (but delicious-sounding) types of donuts for that. The size was slightly smaller than we thought it'd be, however the owner mentioned he had to use smaller donuts for this event. I guess I just need to visit them at their truck instead sometime!

There is a check-in offer for 1 free topping and 1 free sticker. With that, my scoop with one topping was only $4, and you get a cute sticker of their mascot.

I think my expectations were too high because I was a teeeeny bit underwhelmed afterwards. Everything was pretty good, but I was not blown away like I thought I would be, and it was a little pricey for the size (given, these prices were a little higher than normal). I would still come back though, for the creative flavors and combinations...aaand because I am a dessert addict and I want to try their "FK Your Diet" sundae, Cookie Monster, and boba sundae. Yum!
author: Brittney K.

description: Frozen Kuhsterd is a Frozen Custard Dessert Truck. I had a wonderful "taste" when the Truck was parked at the Heritage Day festivities at Old Borges Ranch in Open Space Walnut Creek. It's not quite up to Wisconsin (e.g. Leon's) standards, but it's pretty darn good.
author: Eric B.

description:
I've had Frozen Kuhsterd two times and I loved every bit of it! Frozen Kuhsterd isn't as thick as ice cream and not quite as thin as frozen yogurt. It's somewhere in between but it is definitely rich and creamy. I can't get enough of it. I feel like there is always something new every week. It surely keeps it interesting and has me wanting more and more. I think their newest creation was the white rabbit candy turned into Frozen Kuhsterd. One things for sure, it never gets boring here and it's exciting to see what else they come up with!

The first time I tried Frozen Kuhsterd I had the burnt caramel with the burnt caramel topping. Anyone who loves caramel has to order this! The second time I ordered the cookie monster and halo halo bread pudding (which was one of the specials that week). The cookie monster was exactly how it sounds! It came with three different cookies with two different kuhsterd flavors. I ordered the coffee and cookie butter kuhsterd flavors. Super delicious and I'm pretty much addicted to cookie butter in general. The halo halo bread pudding was satisfying and it was a good mix. I also tried a mini roti kuhsterd bun from Honeyberry. If you've ever had a roti bun from Honeyberry, you can already imagine how good it is with a scoop of Frozen Kuhsterd! It's a match made in heaven! 

Lastly, I always say- no matter how cold or foggy it is outside, there is always room for Frozen Kuhsterd! Now go and get some!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Even if San Francisco was the coldest city in the US and I'd still probably find every reason to visit these guys. Forget Italian Ice, gelato, froyo, or ice cream, kuhsterd in the frozen form is where it's at. As a current east coaster facing unbearable summer humidity, it's hard not to seethe from jealousy after trying the myriad of flavors they have available day in and out.

There is no shortage of wonderful flavors, all must be sampled at some point. There are seasonal concoctions and lots of "premium / exclusive" flavors worthy of palate experimentation. One cannot go wrong with any of them, which means it's a win-win for all!

My favorites from their exclusive flavor line are: Ube (purple yam), Black Sesame, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, Vanilla Bean, and Maple Butter. If you're looking for something with a bit more "umph" it's time to move to the premium bunch of frozen kuhsterd. Ones like Reposado Tequila, Buena Vista, Red Velvet Cake Batter, and the Coffee Mint Mojito are straight game changers. It's all stupidly good that wanting another is only a natural reaction.

The dudes running the truck are super friendly and they sure know how to turn a profit. From around $3.50 a scoop or $5 for two, some folks might wince a bit considering the portion size. If it's just about the experience, throw in some extra $ for a dynamo donut or waffle. Sprinkle some bits of extra toppings to really make it rain.

One last request: Please come to New York?
author: Jando S.

description: I've seen this truck a couple times at OTG & finally save enough room to try it at Stonestown location. Soooooooo good! I had the donut bread pudding with salted caramel custard. The custard was the highlight! Next time I'll have to try the coffee flavor.
author: Charlyn M.

description:
Came across the gem at the Eat Real Festival. I've been coming to this event ever since its inauguration. And boy was excited for Frozen Kuhsterd.
It was nearing the end of our day at ERF, but we needed a dessert, we stumbled upon this massively long line and when we saw the menu we decided to wait in line. 
Lets just say it was TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT. We got the Boba Sundae but the secret one where it was boba AND almond jelly. 

So good, wish we got two. 

Can't wait to spot this truck again!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Got a chance to try at the Tech Carnival.
Waited in a huge line, but it was all worth it.
The guy behind the counter was super friendly and really made my frozen custard experience fun. And made the wait fun too. (honestly I didn't even know it could be fun lol) Normally people who serve you dessert look like they hate their job.. but not this one.

I tried the Thai tea flavor and Coffee... super delicious.
The thai tea really tasted like frozen thai iced tea.. the flavor was there!!
Same with the Coffee flavor. It tasted like there were fine ground coffee beans there.

Worth a try!!
author: Suzie J.

description: I'm a fan! love my ice-cream that doesn't melt too fast.
author: E T.

description:
I forgot the exact name of what I had because I experienced memory loss bliss after the sweet concoction. all I know is, there was a red velvet cupcake, vanilla custard, and condensed milk involved. life changing for sure! 

will be stalking out this truck from now on.
author: Nicolette P.

description:
Destroy my healthy eating habits any day! What guilt do I have? NONE.

My boyfriend and I shared the Potato chip frozen custard with burnt caramel sauce and Donut bread pudding sundae. 

Be careful! Donut bread pudding sundae does contain some traces of peanuts since my boyfriend had to stop eating it sadly. Don't want no allergic reaction while we were out.

But I'm pretty sure he wanted to order everything there after walking a bit in the heat.
author: Corie L.

description:
THAI TEA!

The most amazing and creative flavors accompanied by superior customer service! Yes yes, how can you go wrong!  Very rich flavors and on the sweet side but definitely worth the wait for them to finally be at SJ movable feasts
author: Grace M.

description:
For real, for real, for real my heart bursts with Filipino pride when I discovered Frozen Kuhsterd.  I first encountered this arctic delight at the Eat Real Festival 2013 - the "bibingka Sundae" caught my eye.  At first I thought was this a typo of some sort? Upon closer inspection I realized this is the same "bibingka" from the motherland. 

Peaked my interest and peaked my taste buds. First a lesson in Bibingka- Bibingka is a type of rice cake from the Philippines traditionally eaten during the Christmas season. There are different variations, oh but the taste. For me it's not just the taste but  the fond memories of Post-Christmas eve mass...So, naturally I stood in line for this "bibingka sundae" - the sundae came with a scoop of thai iced tea custard layered in between 2 slices of miniature bibingka cakes and drizzled with ube (purple yam/taro sauce.) 

What a brilliant way to turn an unexpecting bibingka into a masterpiece - which instantly reduced me to a fond childhood memory. Bravo Frozen Kuhsterd!

They also had a surprising take on the ice cream sandwich - not with cookies but with miniature donuts - I mean holy hell (Donut) HOLE - amazing.  Maple Bacon Donut with Four Barrel Coffee Custard - 

I was so impressed with Frozen Kuhsterd that I did my internet stalking, I mean research, and here's what I found:


http://fareandsq.com/2012/05/10/qa-sweet-talk-with-jason-angeles/

Do yourself a favor, whether you're Filipino or not, make your way to Frozen Kuhsterd!
author: Michelle B.

description:
So during Game 7 of the World Series 2014, I decided to buy myself an early celebration treat since I knew the SAN FRANCISCO GIANTS were going to win! And of course they did!

I got the maple bacon Dynamo Donut with chocolate ice cream and caramel sauce. Truthfully, I hated the donut and ended up scraping all the ice cream and caramel off of it... But the ice cream and caramel were amazing. The ice cream is really creamy and surprisingly not too sweet. They gave me a pretty generous scoop. I think it may have been because there weren't too many customers since everyone stayed in to watch the World Series. My lil girl got their graveyard special which was chocolate ice cream covered with Oreo cookie "dirt," gummy worms, and a speculoos cookie. She finished hers quicker than I finished mine! 

The customer service was also great. The workers were helpful at helping me make up my indecisive mind. I would definitely repeat this place. It's too bad that the day I finally decide to try this place, it was their last appearance at OTG: PH.
author: Char D.

description:
When I went they only had 2 flavors available: Thai Ice Tea, and Vanilla.
I got the S'more with Thai Ice Tea Frozen custard.  It was good. The two toasted marshmallows on top was a nice touch in addition to the graham cracker crumbles and the chocolate syrup. 
It seemed a tad pricey for the amount I got, but this is inside a food truck park, so it's expected.
author: Heejin L.

description: I found this truck at an Off The Grid food truck event in Pleasant Hill. I got the Napa Style Sundae for $6 which is vanilla bean frozen custard, burnt caramel, extra virgin olive oil, and Himalayan sea salt. It was very delicious but pricey especially for the small portion the give you.
author: Tootie A.

description: Great customer service and delicious custard!! Super creative sundaes and custard flavors :) can't wait to try some more next time! Oh and adorable free stickers, too great.
author: Jordyn N.

description:
It's no wonder this place has such high reviews. The service is personable and the recipes for their ice cream combinations are unique. I tasted Frozen Kuhsterd at a Halloween event yesterday and the two guys manning the booth had the most adorable ice cream cart ever. 

My group got the boba soaked in Jameson + some sort of ice cream that I didn't quite hear the name of. Boba and ice cream? Whaaaat???! Yes to my surprise, it actually  tasted delicious. The boba was squishy and the ice cream was so creamy. I tried both flavors that they had, and thought the pumpkin flavor was on point. The texture of the ice cream was smooth.

The guys at the booth were prideful in their operation and recipes. They have a food truck, but I hope they get to open a store soon!
author: Christina L.

description:
My work catered from this place for an event and it was pretty good! I tried the Thai tea flavor and it really did taste like I was slurping down a cold Thai tea, minus the ice cubes. I also tried the cereal milk flavor, which tasted like vanilla, but with a subtle cornflake flavor. I liked the Thai tea flavor better, but both were good.

Yay for frozen treats at work!
author: Rachel L.

description:
UM. OMG. HOW HAVE I ONLY RECENTLY DISCOVERED THIS???

I recently met Frozen Kuhsterd at a networking event they were catering, and let me tell you, this stuff is LIFE CHANGING.  I was a little hesitant to commit myself to one scoop of Thai Tea and Black Sesame frozen custard.  Between the two, the Black Sesame really spoke to me, and even though I'm not a huge Thai Iced Tea fan at restaurants, this was absolutely to die for.  Being on a wedding diet, I make myself available to only a few cheat meals, and this was absolutely worth it.  Having had the opportunity to really pick Jason's (the founder of Frozen Kuhsterd and an absolute kick-ass/rock star guy) brain on how this concept came up, and it only makes me want to hit up their truck even more.

I want Greg to try this, and if he loves it, this has high potential for our late night snack to be served during our reception next year :)
author: Lisa I.

description:
So...in between hoping to stalk Ty Flo & pouting that he was no where in sight, I tried the Frozen Kuhsterd truck. The Soma Streat Food Park was crawling with cameramen, PA's, & food trucks from Food Network 'The Great Food Truck Race' (which, admittedly, I've never seen.) 

Today was my first time trying frozen custard...FK, you were fpx's first! I ordered the Boba Guys Sundae (see pic.) OMG, white coffee frozen custard ($6.50, like a creamier, dreamier ice cream), condensed milk, & tender boba. I almost pulled a Meg Ryan a la 'When Harry Met Sally,' it was *that* good. 

The guys running the truck were very sweet. Can't wait to try other flavor combos! 

So...even though Tyler (love of my life) never did show up, my evening was not wasted...I managed to find something else yummy to put in my mouth...
author: Fancypants X.

description:
thai tea frozen kuhsterd. what a brilliant, brilliant idea. 

i've also had their four barrel coffee and sampled their other flavors. i like the boldness in their unconventional flavors. very creative while staying within happy gastronomical boundaries.

let's get FK'd up!
author: Charmaine L.

description:
OWE EEEEM GEEEEEEE

Oh.My.Guhsterd


                         YOGU BOBA SUNDAE

                           |   O O O  O O O |
                           | O  O  O  O  O O| -- Soju soaked boba
                           |   O O O  O O O |   (boba from Boba Guys)
                           |                           | ----- KUHSTERD
                           |                           | --- Yogu Jelly
                           ++++++++++++++  

               O  ----- YES!!!! (Frozen Kuhsterd addict)
              / | \
               / \

Where have you been all my life?! (Not the addict, which is me...but the sundae).

Black sesame Kuhsterd + Soju soaked boba (and pretty good quality boba too from The Boba Guys) + Yogu jelly. What a killer combination.

The black sesame Kuhsterd blows away Marco Polo's black sesame gelato (and even that is purty sexcellent). And is fantastic with the limited edition yogu boba sundae. It's $7 a pop but it's a nice change from spending an hour in line at TPumps with the spring break kids from high school or college (who are either underage or too lightweight to partake in something like this).

The matcha white chocolate is also very very sexy indeed.

Also, don't miss the Napa Sundae. It's vanilla Kuhsterd, EVOO, Hawaiian black (lava) salt, burnt caramel sauce. Extremely decadent. I did a REMIX EDITION and customized it with White Coffee Kuhsterd (great!!!!) soju soaked boba. Incredible multi textured flavored sexyness that surpasses a HK style out of the oven pineapple bun with a slab of salted butter inside!  Because I'm smooth like that, and dats how I roll.

Four barrel coffee? No brainer, make it a Kuhsterd Kafe Sua Da, Boba Sundae. Add Boba Guys boba, condensed milk, and it is quite heavenly.

But Black Sesame. Yoo Ahhh SEXY!

In the words of Ahnuld Schwuhzenugga's character from one of his movies (not the one where he plays an Irish American cop from Chicago and still speaks with an Austrian accent) 

"THIS IS DA REAL QUAID, GET YO AHHHSSSSS TO FROZEN KUHSTERD!"
author: Ken K.

description:
I actively seek out the Frozen Khusterd truck. I follow them all over the Bay Area. They're THAT good!! 

Khusterd is an eggy-er type of ice cream. Thicker denser consistency. Soo yummy. 

Their flavor selection varies everyday but is always on point. And for a truck that just sells frozen custard, they do a great job of offering many options. They average 4-5 flavors a day, but have tons of toppings to mix and match. And are always featuring creative sundaes that include specialty cookies, cupcakes, and desserts. 

Vanilla Khusterd topped with Burnt Carmel and Cornflakes is my absolute go to. Sounds plain and boring. But it's everything but plain and boring. It's like heaven in your mouth!!! Craved it when I was preggers with my son. And almost a year after giving birth, I still crave it like crazy!! 

Other yummy flavors we've tried-- Cookie Butter, Ube, Polvoron, White Coffee (topped with toasted marshmallows!!) All so delicious. Can't go wrong!
author: Arcie Marie D.

description:
I ran into Frozen Kuhsterd at a company event (complimentary!). Hadn't heard of them before... so I lined up. Delicious!

I went with the Thai Tea w/ Condensed Milk TWICE. The third time I got in line, they ran out.

Excellent kuhsterd. Better than ice cream on a windy day? I think so!

--
PHOTO:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/frozen-kuhsterd-san-francisco-3?userid=Vx-l5rI0xAiN4SeBonrgkw#NtZSMzRFYFzjqhO0DKKctw
author: Kevin L.

description:
I finally got to try Frozen Kuhsterd a few months ago during Cal Day when the truck came onto campus! After eating lunch, I wandered over for dessert and saw that they were serving Vanilla, Four Barrel Coffee, Thai Tea, and Honey Graham. Besides the kuhsterd, they also have treats from Dynamo Donuts, Mission Minis, and Boba Guys, so there's lots of options! 

What I ordered:
- Thai Tea Boba Guys sundae ($6.50): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/frozen-kuhsterd-san-francisco-3?select=cneTsUt4WjoM2BzvtmHANw#cneTsUt4WjoM2BzvtmHANw

The boba sundae comes with a single scoop of any flavor, boba, and condensed milk. I thought it was a bit pricey considering two scoops cost $5, but it was yummy nonetheless! I was debating between Coffee and Thai Tea, but chose Thai Tea to make it similar to a frozen boba. The kuhsterd was super creamy with a slightly sticky texture and I really liked it, except towards the end, it ended up being a little overly sweet. This might have been the condensed milk's fault though and if I ordered the sundae again, I would probably omit it since the other ingredients are sweet enough. Boba was soft and chewy, and this was definitely fun to eat!

TIP: Free topping with Yelp check-in offer!
author: Jessica C.

description:
This review is for their vegan ice cream served at Very Vegan Sundays. 
BF and I got the Li Hing Sundae with strawberry ice cream and a scoop of thai ice cream.
O. EM. GEE.  So legit, and so delicious. I admit that I was bracing myself for the "vegan" taste that lingers in some vegan alternatives, but this tasted like the real deal. 

I would add an extra star if I could, in hopes they will add the vegan options to their daily menu. (PLEEEEEASSEEE?)
author: Kathryn U.

description: I am a HUGE fan of fk after 3 days @ HSB Fest in Golden Gate Park eating Thai Tea with Burnt Caramel sauce topping. OMG-stellar treat. Yum. The quality is superb & all organic ingredients. Need I say more? Run over whenever they are featured. As to person saying he can't tell difference between fk flavors/taste & Dreyer's, I would ask, do you pay ANY attention to how your food is sourced & processed?! If 'no', just shop Safeway ice cream aisles!
author: Lin B.

description:
Simply amazing! I have been dyingggggg to try their Thai tea ever since my brother said how much I'd love it. And I do!!! It tastes better than the drink! I'm such a huge sweets eater and this scoop of heaven definitely satisfied my sweet tooth cravings. I had gotten desserts first..... Before getting any real food because I actually went to off JUST for FK...so after all the other food I wanted more Thai tea custard :'( they had another flavor, polvoron - it was ok. Wasn't sure what's it suppose to taste like but it was still good. I hope have something green tea or mango like in the near future!

in addition to their heavenly custards, their customer service was also great. Super friendly and welcoming :) not every truck was like that! Smiles with every scoop, now how about that haha And the little cartoon custard is just too cute ! I can't wait until the next time I get to eat FK's custards again !!!
author: Kristina L.

description:
NAPA STYLE SUNDAE?!?  Perfectly creamy vanilla plus burnt caramel syrup AND olive oil with salt?  Yes.  Do it.

So, for the three of you know follow my reviews: you know I'm a huge frozen custard fan and or snob.  I practically have a shrine to Milwaukee's famous Kopp's frozen custard in my living room.  I sanctimoniously poo-poo'd NYC"s not-quite-Kopp's Shake Shack.  And until I found Smitten's chocolate ice cream in Hayes Valley, I winged constantly about never being able to find the incredibly creamy perfection known as genuine frozen custard anywhere in California.  So when I say that FK's vanilla frozen custard is the real, creamy, fatty, sugary deal, I mean it.  

So why only 4 stars? I had a combo cup with other flavors, and they weren't as good.  But that Napa style Sundae will change your life.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I love dessert. It's always my favorite part of a meal. Naturally I enjoy ice cream too. I had heard good reviews for frozen kuhsterd and was happy to see them in San Lorenzo.

I got the vanilla bean with burnt caramel sauce. Hot damn it was good. I shared with my husband and son, since it's summer and I'm trying to be good BUT we were all basically fighting for more. DELICIOUS!

I have a feeling I will be seeing them every Thursday for food truck mafia, and that makes me a very happy camper.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I went to Off The Grid at Fort Mason for the first time last Friday after dinner, so all I had their was dessert. My sister asked the person working there to recommend us something because everything looked so good. We tried coffee ice cream with red velvet and almonds - omg it was sooooo good! I love cupcakes and I love ice cream and never thought to put them together. It was around $6 so somewhat on the pricer side. Overall I would go back and probably order the same thing again lol
author: Pammy P.

description:
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! This food truck and the guys who run it are the best! It's hard to pinpoint which flavor is my favorite; they're all so unique in their own way. Their frozen custard is so rich and smooth with a lot of volume. This is in contrast to the liquid nitro ice cream that are more chewy in texture.

The thing that makes Frozen Kuhsterd great is the people behind the food truck. Jason and Alex, who are two of the founding partners, are some of the coolest people you would ever meet. During my first visit they made me a beer float, which was not on the menu, after I heard about them making it for a popular ramen restaurant. Yes, this is with real beer and it was damn good. These guys are very accommodating, opened to suggestions and really cool to chat with. 

If you ever spot Frozen Kuhsterd in your 'hood, you must try them.
author: Albert L.

description: Very first time trying frozen custard at this food truck. I had the cinnamon toast + cookies & creme. It was delicious! Tasted like a slightly melted ice cream. Was full of flavor and very creamy. I will definitely be coming back to frozen kuhsterd in two weeks when they're at off the grid!
author: AJ C.

description: DELISH. I love ice cream and I think I'm a great judge when it comes to different types. I love this truck. Don't be turned off by the cereal milk! I first had cereal milk when I was NYC at momofuku and thought it was weird. This time at Frozen Kuhsterd... i LOVED IT! Take a chance with the cereal milk, I assure you that you won't be disappointed!
author: Anh T.

description:
I've been chasing this truck for months and I'm glad I was finally able to catch them near my house at Hiller Aviation.

They're constantly switching custard flavors and dessert, but I got the frozen vanilla custard between a maple bacon donut with salted caramel.
