The custard itself: YUMM! Thick, creamy and rich. It's like ice cream, but better - and I love ice cream! I wasn't even disappointed to pick plain old vanilla. It was delicious!

The maple bacon donut: I could do without this. The donut wasn't as light and fluffy like I like and the bacon tasted really weird. There was too much grease or something and it set off the sweetness of the whole dessert. There was just something about the bacon taste that I wasn't a fan of.

Salted Caramel: I'm not usually a fan of this, but I decided to try it based on the raves of other yelpers. This was actually really good. I like the sweetness of the caramel and it had a really good and not too sticky consistency.

My sister also got a mini peppermint chocolate cupcake - good, though taste like any other peppermint chocolate cupcake. I would rather spend that extra dollar on another topping.

Overall, I'd definitely be back for the custard and try the other desserts when they bring them back!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
I've been wanting to try Frozen Kuhsterd for the longest time, so when I saw their truck at Off the Grid: Serramonte, I was stoked! The wait was about 5-10 minutes, which wasn't that bad because the employees are super friendly and very welcoming. My sister and I decided to share a "Boba Guys Sundae" with a choice of custard (we opted for vanilla bean) topped with condensed milk, and what I assumed was Boba Guys' almond jelly and boba. The total for the sundae was $7, which is a tad bit pricy in my opinion, but was sooooo worth it!

Boba Guys Sundae - This dessert was definitely worth the calories! Boba, almond jelly, condensed milk, and vanilla bean custard was the perfect combination for a chilly night at OtG. I've never had frozen custard before, but this frozen custard was about the consistency of gelato. Also, the boba and almond jelly seemed fresh!

4 stars for now! The dessert and the customer service were amazing. The prices? Not so much.
author: Joyce E.

description:
I love Frozen Custard.

It is really popular in the Dallas area, but currently Frozen Kuhsterd is the only place I've found  in the Bay Area that offers it.

Frozen Custard, like Gelato, has its own unique mouthfeel and taste compared to ice cream.  By its nature, I think Frozen Custard is such a great product, and as such, I think Frozen Kuhsterd is a great food truck.

However, even though Frozen Custard is great, the flavors here didn't really pop.  They aren't the best flavored (or maybe I just tried the wrong flavors), and there is a really small selection, so in a place with actual competition(like the Dallas area), it might not do so well.  But since there are no other options, I am a fan of Frozen Kuhsterd for even existing.

Besides the Frozen Custard, they also offer some baked goods like Dynamo Donuts(unique flavored donuts) and bread puddin' so that they can make bread puddin' sundaes or donut sammiches.  Those options sound cool and would love to try sometime.  Looking through the pictures on Yelp, it appears that they also make really unique items every once and awhile as well.  I like experimental food items and would love to try them sometime.
author: Jason S.

description: My daughter likes this so we were customers twice. She got the smore thingie and it seemed ok. I ordered coffee custard on top of rice pudding. The custard was ok, but the rice pudding was nauseating, like wheaty oatmeal. Can't see how anyone goes for that. Fortunately they were nice enough to replace it. Sorry, I don't get frozen custard at all. Particularly at $6 a pop. If there is a good flan or ice cream truck, sign me up.
author: Amy M.

description:
Its like ice cream but better.

The burnt caramel which was the only flavor i tried - was excellent, intensely rich and creamier than ice cream, and even though it was sweeter than I expected or would've preferred - it kinda works. 

Its basically like an ice cream with all the good qualities - amplified.

If you're a fan of ice cream and dessert - you will be a fan of this truck, if not - you still may be pleasantly surprised.
author: Oleg H.

description: Great dessert food truck.  I don't even care what flavor, everything I've had here has been awesome. The Custard flavors are unique and represent the bay areas food diversity. My favorite is the White Rabbit Vanilla and Cookie Butter. My best toppings are the burnt caramel and the strawberry sauce. I would eat the donut sundae everyday!
author: Vas T.

description:
So I noticed that the Boba Guys work in conjunction with these guys, so I had to check it out. I went to the SOMA StrEAT Food Park today - for the purpose of trying the frozen custard out. I've only had it once in my life, and that was in Seattle at Yellow Leaf (and probably one of my top favourite desserts of all time now). 

I ordered myself a plain white coffee frozen custard and I was totally amazed. I can't wait to go back again and try some different things out (like their sundaes, or their donut + ice cream combos).

Can't wait to check them out again. Definitely my newest favourite dessert.
author: Joanne W.

description: I love desserts, and I LOVE Frozen Kuhsterd! I tried this awesome creation awhile back when my boyfriend brought a pint home.  I took a scoop (truth be told, the whole pint) and immediately fell in love! I have tried cereal milk (one of my favs), thai tea WITH BOBA, and I just tried the irish car bomb sundae today. I love that these are unique flavors you won't find anywhere. Seriously, when have you heard of irish car bomb flavored sundae?  I find them at the SOMA Street Fair in SF and I usually try to get something that I haven't tried already with their creative flavors and toppings. I definitely do come here when I have my cravings for Frozen Kuhsterd and take a pint with me home and with summer time coming around, it will be harder and harder for me to pull away from getting more!
author: Victoria K.

description: Omgggg!!! So good!! I didn't even feel like eating ice cream. I've been visiting SF for a week so I was so full. But my mom said she's split it with me and I caved in...so glad I did! My first bite blew my mind. We shared the burnt caramel flavor. Unreal! Frozen custard is definitely better than ice cream!
author: Christina C.

description:
PROS:
--Came here for Off the Grid at Serramonte for the first time for dessert. When my boyfriend and I first saw it, we were like, "Custard?" I went to just look at the menu and saw that silvana ice cream sandwich and was like, "MMM!"
-Not too long of a line.
---I saw the 2 for $7 deal for two silvanas and choice of ice cream but just wanted to try one. I ALSO had $3 worth of quarters (What a bum, I know, haha) and an actual dollar. I went up to the window and asked if I could just have one and the guy said, "Of course!" and if I could pay in quarters! Embarrassing to the max but he was so nice and even joked around with me and was pleased to accept. 
-I ordered the Ube silvanas and thai tea ice cream. I took one bite, AND WAS AMAAAAZING.


CONS:
--Kinda pricey, (2 for $7, 1 for $4) but it's a food truck, they gotta make that dough doe. ($$$)


OVERALL:
-DEFINITE YUM FACTOR!
-Great service, awesome flavors.
-Plan to definitely stop by next time I see them.
author: Veronica A.

description:
I love this truck!!!! 

I went with the Burnt Caramel and I love caramel. There tons of flavors to chose from though and I WILL definitely change my order on the next run in!!!

Fast service, can have a few people waiting, but you should expect that by now.
author: Roger A.

description:
Warm or freezing weather... I still crave a treat.. or two from the fun and creative guys at Frozen Kuhsterd. 

Love this stuff and love getting FKWASTED! I mean c'mon, always friendly service, the combination of  Frozen Kuhsterd + Boba= WINNER, and don't even get me started on how amazing the burnt carmel topping is!

Although, I still have to try the Thai Tea flavor, which I hear is beyond amazing... but I'll soon eventually get to rave about it myself since FK is going places and it's awesome  to see them in the line up for major food events in the Bay Area, if you haven't gotten FKWASTED, you must!
author: Megan A.

description:
Decadent (and very rich) dessert options for a food truck, for sure.

Most items are big enough to be split, unless you go for a cupcake (which is actually baked by another company and sold on the truck). 

I do think it's pretty expensive for what it is, but you can't say it tastes bad or you'll find similar innovative offerings many other places.
author: Melissa T.

description:
This is by far my favorite dessert food truck in the bay! My first time trying Frozen Kusterd is at a Elite event at the Layover in Oakland. I immediately recognized the artwork too. I can say Frozen Kusterd team is awesome, even while their packed line in the Eat Real Festival they were still able to move the line.

The couple times I tried Frozen Kusterd sweet treats. Avocado is really good and condense milk, OMG! The second time I had FrozenK is when the Eat Real Festival is at full swing. The organic cinnamon toast crunch is a new favorite. It satisfies my sweet tooth for the whole day!

I am going to find myself some more frozen kusterd!
author: James N.

description: yummy! with 6% egg as compared to 2% that's usually in ice cream what isn't to love? eggs make everything better. The custard is silky and actually more creamy then ice cream. the first time I put it in my mouth the owner knew I was a convert. Thanks Yelp events for showing me the light.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
HIGHLIGHTS:
S'MORES SANDWICH
HOT CHOCOLATE

During my recent trip to SF, swung by the Frozen Kuhsterd truck during the Eat Real Festival/First Friday.  Mutual friend Debbie knew the owner of the truck, Jason, who gave us both the S'Mores sandwich and the Hot Chocolate, free of charge.  The S'Mores sandwich was fantastic!  The Hot chocolate was chocolatey but also seemed to have some cold vanilla ice cream in the middle.  Both were awesome!  I wish we had this truck in LA!
author: Navin W.

description:
I have only been able to catch this truck twice. The last time I was here they had a white rabbit candy kuhsterd which I thought was the oddest thing ever. 

I debated whether or not to try it because it can either be super delicious but it can also go really wrong. I decided to give it a try and I was really pleasantly surprised! It was so good and it tasted exactly like the candy. If you are able to catch that flavor, I really recommend that you try it. You won't be disappointed.
author: Diane M.

description:
I pre-order as soon as I find out Frozen Kuhsterd comes to my work.  I came on a rainy day and there was still a line!

My husband is a huge fan of Thai Iced Tea, which he swears is Thai iced tea in ice cream form.  I fell head over heels with their Avocado flavor. Not too sweet or too rich.

The guys that run the truck are really cool.  I feel like they're extended family.  Now if only black sesame is available when I'm in the front of the line to order.
author: Christine L.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd...LOVE!!

It was my first time having frozen custard and I loved it. I wish this truck were around the South bay more often. The line was longer than long at Eat Real '12, but they were able to serve people efficiently, so the line moved fairly quick. 

I'm a huge coffee lover, so I went with Blue Bottle. This was amazing! Mmm. I'm dreaming about this as I'm typing this. The bacon waffle sounded so amazing, too, that I asked for this on the side. 

My bf, whose a big kid, went with the cinnamon toast crunch, no surprise there. He topped his with strawberry sauce and one lick brought me back to my childhood.
author: Cindy T.

description: I was really hesitant to try this place because I have honestly never tried frozen custard or knew what it was; however, after one try, I can honestly say I'm obsessed. My first pick was the smores sundae with vanilla bean custard and it was amazing. It literally tasted like it was a smore toasted over a campfire with the perfect frozen treat to match. I thought it was the perfect combination and sweetness. My second choice was the rice pudding sundae. It had a nice contrast from the cold leche flan frozen custard to the warm and tasty bread pudding. Definitely in love with frozen kuhsterd's creations and unique flavors.
author: Sarah G.

description: FK's Thai tea custard with oreos blows regular cookies and cream flavored desserts out of the water. I've had frozen custard before but I never thought it could be this good. FK needs to have a regular shop at SFSU.
author: Susana T.

description: OMG! I had the champorado sundae with cookies & cream on top, it was sooo ooh good! #pregnantladysdream lol. Thank goodness my husband thought of getting dessert at Off the Grid ^_^
author: Michelle S.

description:
When I think of custard I think of those egg pies that sit in the shiny glass cases of Chinatown's finest bakeries. They call out my name and Frozen Kuhstard was no different. After a couple of beers at Yelp's Beerwalk, I gravitated my way towards Frozen Kuhstard...unique phonetic spelling I might add,. Never before have I had "custard" frozen so it was worth a shot and I was surprised at how creamy it was!  It had the consistency of slow churned ice cream and the flavors were far from the usual! There were two unique flavors to choose from during the event: 

1. Dark Chocolate Stout Beer
2. Honey Graham Cracker

Thanks to Jason's generosity, I was able to sample both. The dark chocolate is super rich and tasted just like chocolate with just the slightest hint of stout at the very end - and how fitting was this flavor for the event?! Love it. As for the Honey Graham Cracker, it tasted exactly like what you'd sandwich your s'mores with!

Now, I told Jason that I would quote him on this and to this I vouch: "This is amazing-ness in a cup." It really is.
author: May D.

description:
YUM! 

I didn't really know what Frozen Kuhsterd was, but its like gelato and ice cream.  If you like your ice cream silky you want Frozen Kuhsterd! 

I loved their Corn Flake (Cereal Milk) & Cinnamon Toast Crunch (Cereal Milk).
author: Arlynn A.

description:
A high quality product from a very nice proprietor. Buena Vista is awesome. I think as Californians, this is a treat that you just dont get here very often. So many other flavors that i need to try.  This is a different flavor everyday for a month!

Blue Bottle Coffee
Four Barrel Coffee
Coffee Mint Mojito
Fresh Mint White Chocolate
Spicy Mexican Chocolate
Spicy Pumpkin Chocolate Pie
Dirty Chai
Cheesecake
Pumpkin Cheesecake
Buena Vista
Cinnamon Toast Crunch (Cereal Milk)
Corn Flake (Cereal Milk)
Port Wine Strawberry
Red Velvet Cake Batter
Guittard Dark Chocolate
Avocado
Vanilla Trinity
Maple Butter
Burnt Caramel with Salted Coffee Caramel Swirl
Roasted Coconut
Spiked Cereal Milk* (Jameson Whiskey and Cereal Milk)
Buena Vista (Jameson Whiskey and Blue Bottle Coffee)
White Chocolate
Cookies N Creme
Green Tea White Chocolate
Tequila*
Peanut Butter
Chocolate Malt
Vanilla Malt
Root Beer Float
Cola Float
author: Kim N.

description:
I loved this food truck. But I was a little bit disappointed because of some ice-cream that has too much sweet toppings.

I prefer some simple ice-cream in this food truck. Vanilla or Oreo thingy was so nice! I love it!
However once I tried something weird ice-cream.. Such as an ice-cream between doughnut, ice-cream that has bunch of toppings (marshmallows with chocolate syrup and peanut butter etc.) I wasn't able to finish my ice-cream.. It was too sweet and sweet. Everyone was freaking out as assuming the calories of that. Never try this kind of icecream if you are considering your weight.. 

In spite of this bad experience of too sweet ice-cream, the reason I give you rating 4 stars is the general ice-cream is awesome. So don't add any other sweet stuffs plz...
author: Summer P.

description:
OMG!  I finally got to try Frozen Kuhsterd after lusting after them online for months.  I was NOT disappointed either.  I had their Four Barrel Coffee and vanilla with almonds. The custard is so creamy and extremely tasty.  I can't wait to try their funnel cake with custard.  Can you think of a dreamier combination?

Special mention to Alexis and owner, Jason, who I got to meet recently.  Keep up the great work and PLEASE visit the South Bay more often!
author: Judi M.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd serves up some pretty tasty treats. Their custard is very smooth like soft serve, but it's a lot more creamier and has a much richer flavor. I've had pretty good luck with Thai Tea and condensed milk.

There's some things that could improve. The Spiked Cereal Milk needed more booze. I couldn't really taste any Jameson in it when I had it. Now that I think about it, they could probably put more cereal in it too. The burnt caramel sauce also didn't taste that burnt. It just tasted like plain caramel. Bi-Rite's awesome caramel has way more of that intense burnt flavor which makes it taste so amazing. 

I haven't tried all the flavors, but I think Frozen Kuhsterd is pretty enjoyable overall. They stop by my work almost once a week so that makes it a lot more convenient too. It'd probably be 3 stars if I had to go out of my way to get there.
author: Nei N.

description: DELICIOUS is all i can say. The bread pudding Custard is amazing. Great staff, very friendly. I get excited everytime I see this truck somewhere!
author: Jason D.

description: I never really considered until I wrote this review that 3 stars was A-OK. I used to consider to mean, yeah, good, but some major issues. But I'd have to put Kuhsterd at A-OK. It's tasty but I didn't feel that the flavors really "popped" for the price. I would go for the Toast Crunch if anything - better than anything else we tried on that cold, windy day.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
A well-executed, clever dessert idea for all seasons. 

Kreamy Kuhsterd: It's been a year since we've met but, baby, you still turn me on.
author: Lara W.

description:
So yummy! I feel fortunate to have gotten the chance to catch up with this food truck (they only make frozen custard) when they came down the peninsula to Hiller Airplane Museum. We tried four scoops and enjoyed them all as they were smooth and creamy as they should be. The toppings made them even punier, elevating them to a gourmet treat. The strawberry topping is homemade and you can really taste it, its Devine. Marshmallows toasted to perfection, with a slight char on them really brought a lot of flavor to the party (if you're not a fan of the charm try these they are so good that they might make you a believer.

I did start with my toughest test, vanilla. If they can get vanilla right then you know that they are paying attention and care about the product they are serving you. Their vanilla is good enough that I ordered  second cup so I could focus on their yummy toppings. I recommend that you ask for samples because everything I tasted was so yummy that I can't ecocide just one. Give them a try and pick your own favorites.

The service was excellent prices reasonable, and the owner, Jason was super friendly, was happy to answer my million questions patiently and thoroughly. The speed of service was very good and in the two hours tat I hung out at the food event I did not spot one error. Every single customer was very happy.

=======

Since Frozen Custard is new to the West Coast I though I'd offer a guide to get everyone interested up to speed:

Frozen custard was invented in Coney Island New York in 1919 and is essentially ice cream with added egg yolks which gives it a creamier texture. It was popularized in the 1933 Chicago World's Fair which is why I believe that most people erroneously believe that frozen custard is a Midwest only treat. It actually has existed on the East Coast (I remember enjoying it in the sixties and seventies in New York City) and is still available there, albeit not as easy to find as in the Midwest.

Because true frozen custard is very dense, the maker can adjust how much air it contains as the cream is stirred (air is not added or pumped in) during its creation. The most dense frozen custards will only have 15 to 35% air (overrun) but in some regions, frozen is served as a "Soft Serve" with 100% overrun (meaning that it is half air). This causes a lot of confusion with soft serve ice creams, but the two actually are different products.

Ice cream by definition in the US, is: a frozen dairy dessert that contains between 10% and 16% milkfat; 9 to 12% milk solids-not-fat (this where the casein and whey protein are located plus carbs; 12% to 16% sweeteners; 0.2% to 0.5% stabilizers and emulsifiers (yuck) and finally 55% to 64% naturally occurring water. If the ice cream has air intentionally pumped into it (most except gourmet ice creams have huge amounts of air in them) then these numbers would be lowered to as much as half of what is listed here.

If you add egg to that, then you get a frozen custard however, different people and different regions, make it differently. Some adjust their machines to work the custard a little more which traps more air into it so they can over it as soft serve, some add so many egg yolks that it takes on an eggy yellow tint.

In the US a frozen custard, according to the FDA, is suppose to have at least 10% milk fat and at least 1.4% egg yolk solids. FDA Frozen Desserts 21 CFR 135.110(a)(2)

I recall seeing recipes in New York calling for egg yolks to be added but they called it an Ice Cream or a rich ice cream or a premium ice cream even though they were technically frozen custards. I suspect there are a lot more people out there enjoying frozen custard than actually realize it.

My favorite frozen custards are the ones that are eggy (otherwise why bother) and firm (low percentage of air in it) because they are most different from gourmet ice cream.
author: Bob L.

description:
My first year of Eat Real Festival and my 3rd day in a row for frozen kuhsterd, I came on a Friday with my sisters for their vanilla and thai tea flavor! 

The thai tea was amazing and its all homemade!!! I came back on a Saturday hoping for their thai tea flavor but they replaced it for Blue Bottle coffee flavor , which was also good, and the line was crazy long!! Omg, but anywho, I came back today (Sunday morning/ 1st in line) and today must be my  lucky day, they have a gallon left of the thai tea flavor, so I got a snoop of Blue Bottle coffee flavor and a snoop of thai tea flavor frozen kuhsterd!! Ahh, made my morning! Yes, I had frozen kuhsterd for breakfast !! That was yumm!! I am hooked!! I shall hunt them down the next time when I am in the city!! ;-) 

Thanks Jason and Alex for getting my custard in a jiffy!! Oh, and sorry for being a ladybug about the thai tea flavor frozen custard, I really wanted my thai tea frozen kuhsterd.. :-X
author: Nancy C.

description: Had a chance to try it out at Yelp's Spring Fling at the Oakland Museum recently and they did not disappoint. Choices were Thai Iced Tea or White Coffee. I went with the White Coffee, made with Four Barrel coffee, and it was creamy and delicious, just like coffee ice cream but creamier. I can't wait to find their truck and try some of their other flavors.
author: Ian A.

description:
Did not live up to the hype.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: I was so upset that the Tuesday that my boyfriend had off was the day that they weren't going to be at Serramonte OTG.. I follow them on Twitter @frozenkuhsterd and they announced that the we're going to be there! Yay! I crave this as soon as I'm done with my frozen custard. Yes. It is that good. I've only tried the vanilla bean and Thai tea custard sundae, but ohhh my my my... They are the best. It cost $6.50, and worth every penny! It's soo creamy, sweet and just melts in your mouth. Their boba is pretty good too. The employees in the truck are always so kind and helpful! They let you sample their different flavors if you want! I'll be back next week! :)
author: Pauline E.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd is hella good! 

The Frozen Kuhsterd truck was parked outside the Asian American Art Museum for last night's CAAM film festival's screening of Amrit Singh's "Dosa Hunt" and rap performance by Indian Bastards from Hell (Himanshu + Dapwell of Das Racist fame) and after peeping all the stellar Yelp reviews, I knew I had to try.

I was initially undecided between the Thai iced tea and black sesame flavors, so the rad folks scooping the frozen custard (similar to ice cream with the addition of eggs!) yesterday let me sample both and then decide. Thai iced tea easily won out...and a day later, I'm STILL thinking about that deeply flavored, perfectly creamy, slightly spiced, delectable frozen iteration of Thai iced tea!

Forget fried bananas, sweet sticky rice pudding and roti drenched in condensed milk, every Thai restaurant in the City should have THIS on their dessert menu!
author: Cheryl L.

description:
Have you been FK'd yet? 

Mmmm, the creamy goodness. I've never had any of their sundaes or cupcakes, but the custard alone is amazing. Flavors I've tried: vanilla bean, thai tea, cookie butter, cookies n creme, toasted almond, horchata, and cinnamon toast crunch - still so many more to try! My favorites are definitely horchata and cinnamon toast crunch. You can also add toppings for .50 cents each, but I like it by itself. Oh and the girls that take your order are always pleasant! 

Update - They now have the "Boba Guys Sundae" at Moveable Feast: Foster City! Yay. It's a sundae featuring a single scoop of your choice, almond jelly, condensed milk, and San Francisco's own Boba Guys' boba for $6.50
author: Alexandra K.

description: I'm biased since I love anything frozen and/or with custard.  Thus, this is the closest to a hybrid of ice cream and custard with unique creations and combinations of toppings.  The Napa sundae was a delight with the salt on top for a savory taste.  i'll have to find this truck and try some other flavors again.
author: Jenny L.

description: Finally found the frozen kuhsterd truck after all these years at the Off the Grid in Serramonte. Every time I wanted to come there was always some special event going on in the SOMA Street Food park. Anyway, it was a nice and sunny, yet windy day and I was in mood for frozen custard. I know the best Frozen Custard is in Las Vegas, so I needed to find something similar here in SF Bay Area. The Napa Sundae cost $6 because they used organic ingredients, vanilla custard, Carmel and sea salt. I thought since I drove all the way out here, I might as well splurge. it was very tasty and great to have after I had dinner. Creamy and smooth texture. I can taste the sea salt which gave it an interesting taste mixed with the Carmel. Yummy in my tummy as I took my time eating it. I was impressed that it came with a thick and big blue  spoon. I will keep this sturdy spoon. :-) Next time, if I am the area on a Tuesday, I'll be sure to stop by.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Chatted up the owner, Jason, at a Yelp Elite event for a while last night. Really nice guy, he was totally open to criticism and was super friendly, and I've been considering doing my own food start-up and he gave me a lot of tips.

His custard is denser than ice cream, more smooth, and it actually freezes at a higher temperature so it doesn't hit your mouth as cold as ice cream. The flavor last night was Pumpkin Cheesecake and while it had a deliciously strong cheesecake flavor, my friend and I couldn't taste the pumpkin as much. I noticed it a little when I went back for seconds. The graham cracker crust crumbles on top add nicely to the flavor, giving it a much more authentic cheesecake feel.

Jason was also really cool about taking suggestions for flavors too. He draws  inspiration from our shared faves - Momofuku Milk Bar, Humphrey's Secret Breakfast. We also both LOVE Bi-Rite's roasted banana.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Great tasting ice cream. I tried the vanilla, coffee, and chocolate. I went with the scoop of chocolate + burnt caramel. The combo was a bit sweet for me, so next time I'll keep it simple and stick with just a scoop (or maybe add some nuts on top).

The coffee flavor is outstanding. It tastes like their premium vanilla custard blended with ground up beans.

The sundaes are a little pricey. I would just stick with getting the regular scoops and maybe add one topping.
author: Ron Y.

description:
Let it go.

Over 200M enthusiastic views: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=moSFlvxnbgk

Over 200 enthusiastic reviews: Creamier than ice cream. Tastier than gelato. Not nearly as healthy as frozen yogurt.

Just one scoop into this decadent and delicious vanilla treat knew this was a moment to let all healthy eating discipline go.
author: Jason B.

description: I've been to this spot a few times in the last couple of months and really enjoyed my experiences.  I've had the Cinnamon Toast Crunch Custard with Chocolate Syrup, Ube Custard and Polvoron Custard Sundae.  All were very good and had the perfect amount of creaminess.
author: Ken G.

description:
Hellllllllllllz yeah, this custard is the bomb diggity! The Jamo Corn Flake concoction is super tasty. I am kinda upset that I can't have any right now. I need more! MORE WHISKEY CUSTARD!

I hope they will be at the next Yelp! event that I attend.
author: Justin C.

description: Tried out the Frozen Kuhsterd truck at the Foster City Movable Feast night.  They offer a competitive price.  I had a single scoop with burnt caramel. Really good combo.  I didn't notice that they offer boba.  If I ever get to try out this truck again, going to get boba.  Mmmmm!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Thai Tea, Cereal Milk, Blue Bottle Coffee, Chocolate Malt, Polvoron, Mint Chocolate Chip, Vanilla Bean, Cookie Butter....

No that's not FK's menu...it's all the flavors I've tried. (I'msoashamednonotreally)

There are no bad flavors, only ones that you might love more than others. And there are new flavors all the time...it's obv these guys take their craft seriously.

The variety of toppings, like the Kuhsterds, is always fresh and inventive. Silvana ice cream sandwich?!? (If you don't know about silvanas, it's worth the google I promise). Donut bread pudding sundae?!?! Boba?!? Eff yes.

Tip: Save room and time for your Frozen Kuhsterd. Savor the smoother-than-butter texture, high quality ingredients. And keep going back and trying new flavors.
author: Angelica T.

description:
I am not a frozen yogurt or custard kinda gal.  I like mine just plain ice cream.  No matter how sugar coated it may seems. I am not sold.

Having said that, I had the pleasure to attend a loopt event held by my friend, Connie, and there I was introduced to a upcoming company by the name of Frozen Kuhsterd.  At first, I had no inclination to try something new and from two guys with frozen custard in their hands.  I went ahead anyways and was blown away.  It was very creamy in texture and actually tasted like ice cream. Yummy!

Because of their persistent and passion for their products, I had the opportunity to taste a delicious product in which i wouldn't have try.  I like that .  Taste and determination is a good combination.

Two nice looking guys with spoonful of what look like and taste like ice cream.  I am totally sold.  Won't you?.............
author: Angela L.

description:
GOT THE LAST T-SHIRT!! Big upps for letting me have it.

Just like my Elite gal pals Jane A. & Mary-Anne C. (who already beat me to reviewing this place,) I too had the priveledge of sampling some Frozen Kuhsterd at last night's Yelp's Elite Event.

Oh my word. BLEW.MY.MIND. 

SPIKED CEREAL MILK!!!!! As with most great inventions, Jason confirmed my suspicions that it was created on a fluke and I am so thankful for this wonderful discovery!! I'm surprised I never thought of it myself because I used to drink Jameson like it was my job, paired with cereal and milk as the perfect hangover cure but I never thought of actually ingesting the two together and thank goodness someone was thinking out of the box (or really really drunk) when they created this heavenly concoction. 

When I think of cornflakes in milk, I automatically think of nasty soggy cornflake chunks that have been sitting in milk too long and are falling apart and hanging together for dear life but this version is NOT even like that!! The cornflake is such a sweet little surprise in constrast to the smooth creamy texture, and then TA-DA, here comes that Jameson flavor to heighten the experience even more. I swear, it was a party in my mouth and only Frozen Kuhsterd was invited. 

The cookies & cream flavor was okay too but SCM stole the show and seemed to be a crowd fave, perhaps b/c it's so "different?" I wanted to ask them about other liquor infused flavors in the future (Hennessy Sugar Cone, or Vodka Cranberry perhaps? Let's patent this now!) but didn't want to seem like an alcoholic. I was already a groupie at their table the whole night asking for seconds as well as bumming off Mary-Anne & Yohanna's seconds, and then eventually thirds. I probably would've eaten out of the container if they hadn't ran out and plus I started to get drunk off it (just kidding, maybe, maybe not) and plus my stomach started to hurt (really though but it was my fault, not theirs). Major crackhead status with the Spiked Cereal Milk. Like, seriously. Even up to now, I still can't stop thinking about it. I need counseling for my obsession and withdrawal, it's almost frightening.
 
The only advice I have for them is why aren't these small batches packaged yet??!!! Let's expand on the business development, and commercialize a little bit, unless you want me to stalk you and I'll totally eat up all your supply everywhere you go. Like Mary-Anne C. said, if you EVER need a taste-testing panel, holler!!!!.... and I'll even work for you in exchange for pints of Spiked Cereal Milk. I already have my uniform, my handy dandy Frozen Kuhsterd t-shirt.

Big Supporter here. Frozen Kuhsterd Forever.
author: Joraine C.

description:
:Q

The reviews don't lie--Frozen Kuhsterd is AH-MAZING! 

I had the pleasure of trying Frozen Kuhsterd at Rock Wall Winery in Alameda. I ordered the Corn Cereal Milk custard with cornflake topping (free with yelp check-in).

O-oh man. So good. So good. It tasted just like a rich soggy cereal AND I LOVE SOGGY CEREAL. The crunchy cornflakes also added to the custardy cereal experience, mmm.

The service was very friendly and happily offered samples. 10/5 stars, will try again.
author: Adri A.

description:
EASY PALATE PLEASERS
(5 stars)

Stumbled upon Frozen Kuhsterd at the Elite Yelp event at Rickshaw Bag Works and was instantly a fan, follower, and future stalker. I'll give you six stars if you add an extra scoop in my serving. They are a traveling piece of work, follow them on twitter (@frozenKuhsterd) to get your FIX'Ns...

I'm a huge icecream kind of person, so I'm sure i'll like frozen custard. I'm very picky with the taste of my frozen desserts but Frozen Kuhsterd had me hypnotized after a dabble of their spiked cereal. AND it's 97% organic (there's one ingredient that wasn't organic - fogot what it was) but i'm on the healthy regine and majority of my meals are organic; so that fact definately put a smile on my face.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

SPIKED CEREAL - The texture of the of the frozen custard was very smooth and light, kind of like froyo. And the infused flavor, THESE YOUNG PROFESSIONAL STREET VENDOR SCIENTISTS ARE GENEIUSES. The infused flavors worked well against each other and not one flavor was over powering then the other. 

Will i be back? I'd love to try their other flavors. Great meeting them personal and wish them the best success. 

JABA APPROVED... Until the next review.
author: Jane A.

description:
Forget about Bi-Rite, Mitchell's and Humphrey Slocombe! Frozen Kuhsterd is the best frozen treat in town. Every unique flavor is perfectly creamy and smooth, with just the right amount of flavor that it doesn't overpower the natural delicious taste of the ice cream.  

The owners are all extremely awesome, genuine dudes that are very passionate about what they do. They also showcase their Filipino heritage, as well as various other fusions of different ethnic cuisines in many of their flavors and interesting sundae creations. 

I also love that they partner with other cool local businesses like Dynamo Donuts, Four Barrel Coffee, and Don Bugito, and even host pop-ups on their truck. 

All these things combined make Frozen Kuhsterd one of the most important innovators currently shaping the future of the Bay Area food scene, and I definitely see big things happening for them.
author: Joshua M.

description:
You don't have to like ice cream to like Frozen Kuhsterd.

Well, you can't *hate* ice cream, or at least the basic properties of it (cold, soft, flavored), but if you know me, you know that I'm a real scrooge when it comes to ice cream reviews. Why?

Because ice cream shops always serve up flavors that you would never find in real life. Would you ever *eat* a rocky road of your own volition? Not a real rocky road, but a smattering of nuts, chocolate chips, and marshmallows? No. And so general ice cream flavors are commoditized, shops are fine peddling them, and reviewing such product is a lot like eating dutch crunch from three different sandwich shops and claiming that one is head over heels.

But what if your ice cream was something more? If it were measured not along a dimension of "flavor," but a dimension of experience? Like the good old fashioned soda machine days, before coca cola and Pepsi owned 90% of the market? Ice cream flavors like Cereal Milk? or Thai Tea?

I can feel myself getting too into this review already, so I'm going to cut it short. Try those flavors if you happen to pass by Frozen Kuhsterd, and tell me it wouldnt be worth standing in line for. And let me tell you how much I hate standing in lines...
author: Christophe C.

description:
I tried Frozen Kuhsterd out at Eat Real Festival 2013 based on the recommendation of Yelp itself (per its' Eat Real Gluttony Guide). Unfortunately, I had been banking on trying their Dynamo Donut sandwich with Four Barrel coffee custard, but it wasn't available at the time, so I ordered Thai Tea frozen custard with burnt caramel and condensed milk as toppings instead.

I have to say, I was pretty much blown away. I knew I was risking extreme gastrointestinal distress (I'm lactose intolerant), but I couldn't pass this goodie up. Due to my own ineptness, I couldn't finish the frozen treat because it ended up being too sweet (darn you, sweet tooth, for wanting caramel AND condensed milk!!).

I only wish this food truck was closer to the Financial District (and that it wasn't approaching winter...) so I could eat this delectable dessert more often! Some of their other flavors sound AMAZING and I'm definitely going to try a new one whenever I happen to come across them!
author: Anna W.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd looks and tastes similar to gelato but isn't gelato.  something about egg whites and density. the main thing, the texture is tight. no air holes.

locale: firehouse art collective(6/26)

pricing: 3.50/scoop, 5/2 scoops
flavors: strawberry with port wine, blue bottle coffee.
-strawberry sublle
-coffee flavorful not full flavored.

kuhsterd drips:
-addictive, couldn't stop eating it
-not too sweet, sugar probably not added.
-samples freely given.
-would repeat with other flavors.
author: Victor G.

description:
Soo good! We tried the Napa and the bread pudding ice cream. The bread pudding made the ice cream to heavy and not as awesome as I hoped.

However, the Napa ice cream was delicious and perfect! Can't wait to try it again!
author: Iliana B.

description:
The guys here are REALLY nice.  They look like aspiring hip hop artists with a part time food gig... which seems to be the thing.  I don't know why I'm shocked at their friendliness -- it must be from the eclectic/fancy food = stuck up attitude.  But here, they offer you samples when you're not sure and just emit a really good vibe.  

The Four Barrel coffee custard is really delicious and strong.  I probably didn't have it in the ideal setting at the Forage SF Underground Market where they don't have proper cooling.  My custard melted fast.

Before ordering, I also sampled the cereal milk flavor which totally tastes like the name.  Now if only they could implement a variety of cereal flavored milk.  I wouldn't mind some Apple Jacks cereal milk... hint hint.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Had the opportunity to taste Frozen Kuhsterd for the very first time at a Loopt event.  Wow, my first thought was, amazing, delicious, flavorful goodness!  Then, I was introduced to the two guys who are the creators/makers of these delicious frozen custard goodness and I was even more impressed.

They really care about their creations, and it really shows.  Even at the event, they kept asking every person who tasted the two flavors what their thoughts and feedback were... I like that they are super humble about their products but at the same time they know what they have rocks... 

Can't wait to have more of that creamy yummy deliciousness!
author: Cindy C.

description:
Frozen custard? Mmmm, who knew?

Was at the Bacon Festival today and Frozen Kuhsterd happened to be there. Tried their special Waffle Bacon bits on top of Vanilla Bean and it was delicious. Babe tried their White Coffee flavor and that was very tasty too. Flavors are perfectly balanced with flavor and sweetness and the texture is extremely creamy and smooth; very similar to gelato. I'm extremely curious of their White Rabbit flavor since I loved that candy as a kid. Too bad their not located here in SJ... or it might be a good thing because I'd be visiting this place everyday which would not be good for my waist line...
author: Vivian K.

description:
It was a nice sunny day at the Dolores Park on Sunday.  Friends and I were picnicking and two guys come to us and ask us if we've ever had Frozen Custard.  A collective No and an offer of free samples captured our attention.  One of the owners, Jason was offering up a Four Barrel Coffee and a Mexican Chocolate.  Both were equally amazing.  The texture is nothing like what you would expect.  Its like a mix of ice cream and soft serve.  The coffee was better than Hagen Daz Coffee, I swear to God.  The Mexican Chocolate had a good amount of cinnamon and I don't even usually like Chocolate ice cream.  We ended up buying a pint of each, which was a "special" intro price of $6 a pint.  

If you see these guys around the Mission, do yourself a favor and try the stuff.  You won't see ice cream in the same way!  BTW, you can follow them on twitter according to them!
author: Anthony N.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd - They're absolutely unstoppable.

Since day one, they've been on a mission to differentiate themselves from other desserts. They're better than your traditional ice cream or soft-serve fro-yo. They push boundaries and bring us the unexpected.

From Thai Tea to Peaches & Cream, they never cease to amaze.
author: Brenda C.

description:
Had a couple rounds of Avocado and Milk & Cereal custards at the recent Yelp Event at The Layover Lounge. Both custards were delicious and not too overwhelmingly sweet. It was very creamy. Jason was really nice and took care of us as we were waiting for the lounge to open up. The avocado was refreshing. I was surprised with and without the condensed milk how the flavors did not fight each other and the avocado flavor shined. I really want the cereal they topped the milk custard with. Very crunchy and played to my other senses.

Hope to get to taste more of their concoctions (for a reasonable price of course ;) )
author: Carolen M.

description:
i had this yesterday when is was 40 degrees from the food truck hu hu hu -.- 
not the cheapest ice cream i had but one of the best. i had the 4 barrel coffee ice cream, and god it was good. it actually taste like coffee unlike the really sweet types. really good! definitley reccomend it :)
author: Claire S.

description: FK's Thai Tea flavor is absolutely delicious. Gotta come back to try all of the other flavors they have. Would highly recommend to anyone to go try you won't be disappointed!
author: Lester F.

description: We hired Frozen Kuhsterd to make ice cream sundaes at our 150 person wedding in Piedmont, CA. The sundaes were a huge hit - we had guests going back for multiple servings, and everyone was raving about the "Napa Style" special sundae, consisting of vanilla custard, EVOO, homemade burnt caramel sauce, and Himalayan sea salt. Frozen Kuhsterd ended up being one of the highlights of the wedding for guests, and we've received endless compliments from guests. The Frozen Kuhsterd staff was professional, friendly, and easy to work with. They brought a branded cart that looked great at the venue and their overall presentation was great. The quality of the custard is exceptional - if you're a soft serve fan, or frozen yogurt fan - you'll love it. The flavors are unique and they don't use any artificial flavors or colors. I hope to work with them again!
author: Chloe S.

description:
Pretty freakin' delicious! 

Love the smooth and creamy texture, and the variety of options.
Definitely prefer this to Smitten...
author: Christine S.

description: Customer service strictly: never showed for an event that they were invited to and accepted. I am sure the kuhsterd is good, but wouldn't know...nice job!
author: John C.

description:
Welcome to BESTEST Frozen Custard Truck in the world!
You will not find this quality, flavor, and great food trucker, Jason & Alex!!!!!

I've eaten 
*Black sesame
*Green Tea Macha w/ White Chocolate 
*Cinnamon Toasted Crunch
*Irish Coffee
*Cereal Milk
*Taro
*Irish Whiskey
*Chocolate Molt
*Potato Chips
...and more!!!!!
These are all flavor you may able to taste, but they have different flavors every time.

I've never tasted FK x Dynamo Donuts combination so far, but all pic tells me everything and my hungry stomach says "Go get it and destroy it!!!!!"

I would love to have it someday soon!

Give FK yourself, you'd NOT disappointed every scoop :-)
author: Marina K.

description: This food truck was at my high school's 75th anniversary carnival and thank goodness. It was a very hot day and they made many sales. I liked the Thai ice tea flavor and I want more.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
This is my 2nd time and they improved their offerings to 5 sundaes that use Mission Hill Bakery, Dynamo Donuts and another local food purveyor at SF.
Service was excellent and provided me a sample because I was so indecisive between the Four Barrel Coffee and their Thai Tea. The Four Barrel Coffee has a strong, smooth and chocolate notes coffee frozen custard,but this wasn't too rich. On the other hand, you got to try the Thai Tea (one of their seasonal flavors),a distinctive Thai ice tea in frozen custard that tingle my taste buds wanting more. These flavors are exceptional on their own. 
I tried their Burnt caramel bread pudding sundae,so you can choose 1 flavor with bread pudding and their owned Burnt caramel. I would rate this as a 4.5 because the bread pudding complemented well with the Thai tea frozen custard but the Burnt caramel was thick buy cloying sweet. I didn't taste burnt notes of caramel though. This sundae is too sweet but it was kind of comforting because of the bread pudding. It tasted like the Spotty Dick, an English bread pudding that had some spices but the Burnt Caramel was the sauce. Of course, the sundae was topped with freshly made whipped cream. This cost $6 .
You should try their Napa style sundae= it's their vanilla bean frozen custard with a light EVOO  (not too strong olives oil but good for dessert), and their caramel sauce. Don't let EVOO fool you or stray away for just trying their sundae. Also,try their donut or cookie ice cream sandwiches.Yummmm.....:)
Only dessert ice cream truck I would go back to try for dessert. They had 4 featured flavors at that time during the Fremont Street Eats (Vanilla Bean, Strawberry, White Chocolate Mint and Thai Tea). 
Check on their Twitter and their website where they are going to be at. This custard was 4.5 because it was smooth, dense and  the flavors were phenomenal. They will rotate 4 flavors at a time, and sell baked goods like cupcakes,  and few other baked goods from Mission Hills Bakery and Dynamo Donuts. Then they partnered Four Barrel Coffee to make a signature coffee frozen custard. Then Frozen Khusterd makes over 30 original and seasonal flavors of this frozen dessert. They are the only dessert food truck that makes excellent frozen custard in the West Coast. Try it and you won't regret it.
Service is 6/5. I mean the girl was a sweetheart and gave me 2 samples because of my indecisiveness between the Four Barrel Coffee and Thai Tea flavors. Their scoops are huge for a Single ($3.50) and it was like almost 3.5 to 4 inches high. The Kid scoop is like $3 which almost 2 to 2.5 inches  in height. The double scoop is $5. They offer ice cream sandwiches, cones, scoops and their signature sundaes partnered with other local SF bakeries and a coffee purveyor.
Food is 5 and menu has greatly improved. 
Ambiance is still bustling, busy, and yuppie happy feeling. Cleanliness is 5.
author: Jade M.

description:
Best. Frozen Custard. Ever. 

Really enjoyed my thai tea flavor custard. Perfectly creamy, sweet, and rich. I think it was near $3 for their smallest size? Good price!

Will be hunting this truck down for more custard!!
author: Ashley N.

description:
I haven't tried the frozen custard yet, but I just met the mastermind behind this genius concoction @ the Yelp in the Hundred Event earlier today. His name is Jason and he's a cool dude. I only talked to him for a few minutes but his outgoing personality was mesmerizing. I could tell that he is passionate about the food that he puts out. Very knowledgable, too. He, himself, deserves 5 stars already.

He is currently cranking out his next project: Sugar & Spun, which is his own take on cotton candy. You know something is as good as it looks if it gets written in the newspaper. Read it here: http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2013/08/08/sugar-spun-brings-a-new-kind-of-cotton-candy-to-san-francisco-with-some-help-from-shrek/

At the Yelp event, I tried the four barrel latte and chocolate banana cotton flavor. Although both flavors were unique, I liked the four barrel latte more. Coffee anything will always win my heart over. But don't fret if you're not a coffee lover. They offer other flavors such as spiced mango, strawberry and cream, and cheesecake. Who would've thought that cotton candy can portray such flavors and still be tasty? It lightweight reminds me of cupcakes, except it won't create a crumbly mess. Give it a try!
author: Annie S.

description: Kids scoop vanilla bean with burnt caramel. Delicious! Loved the vanilla bean flavor. The burnt caramel flavor wasn't overpowering. Definitely going to be one of my favorite combos.
author: Yvonne B.

description: Been wanting to Frozen Kuhsterd in ages and was so excited to finally get to when I saw them at the Eat Real Fest 2013. So many that I wanted to try but unfortunately I didn't have a big group w/me to share so had to settle on one for this round. I enjoy Four Barrel Coffee so opted to try this flavor first (especially since I love Blue Bottle from Humphrey's). The frozen custard was sooo creamy and had lots of flavor. I simply can't wait to find them again and try their other flavors!
author: Kitty K.

description:
The people that work the food truck are awesome! Genuinely super friendly people and are clearly passionate about their custard. They were basically dancing with joy when explaining the different flavor / topping combinations. It was awesome. 

Speaking of the custard- wow SO good. I got the blue bottle coffee with almonds and each bite was divine. They had a ton of super intense sundays and combos involving donuts, but that's not my style. Just give me a scoop!
author: Kerry M.

description:
I never paid much attention in my high school U.S. history class, but I do seem to recall my teacher mentioning all sorts of terrible things happening during "Custard's Last Stand." 

I don't get it.  I tried Frozen Kuhsterd's Thai tea flavor ($3.50 for a large scoop) at the SF Street Food Festival, and it was wonderfully delicious.   How can something so sweet and flavorful and creamy bring about anything besides peace?  Imagine a creme brulee, but denser and served cold.  You can customize your custard with toppings, including the condensed milk that was recommended to me as a complement to the Thai tea flavor, but I found no need for the added accoutrements.  It was just sweet enough all on its own.

Oh, I see:  it's Custer, not Custard, for all you history buffs.  Well, I think the lesson to be learned is that the U.S. would have had more luck winning over the Indians with Custard than Custer.
author: Peter C.

description:
Decadent y delicious! Silky, creamy texture that only frozen custard can give :) YUM!!!

The Thai tea and condensed milk combo was bomb!!! As was the coffee with corn flakes! 

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: Spotted their truck at an Off the Grid. I hadn't heard about them but I've recently developed this interest in frozen custard for the past year ever since I was introduced to it in the Mid West and so I knew I had to try Frozen Kuhsterd. I opted to not get any additional toppings or drizzle because I just wanted to taste the frozen custard on its own and a good frozen custard does not need to hide behind any toppings. I got the thai tea and coffee flavors and they were absolutely delicious! I can't wait for the day I spot this truck again so I can try their other flavors!
author: Cindy N.

description:
I actually tried them at a Health festival in Union City at Quarry Lakes and it was a REALLY warm day and frozen sounded delish!

they have a few flavors out for us to buy, coffee, vanilla bean, taro, thai tea

OH MAN OH MAN was it freaking DELISH!!

My BF and I tried the Four Barrel Coffee and Thai Iced Tea - HOLY moly so GOOD

OVERALL: They need to come to the east bay more often!! :)
author: Natasha S.

description: Feedback is everything. The custard alone is good. IMO it tastes just like ice cream. So given the price for one scoop you are better off going to B&R. The specials that feature donuts, cupcakes and what not are terribly stale and taste terrible. Fix this. There is no excuse for it. Just fix it.
author: Jin S.

description:
Nom nom nom, yum yum yum :)

I've been a Frozen Kuhsterd groupie for awhile; more like I followed where it will be parked and finally saw that they were going to be at Off The Grid in Daly City! I jumped on the chance to go here and eat dinner just so I can try Frozen Kuhsterd.

I had the Thai Tea and Four Barrel Coffee - I prefer the Thai Tea more. It's extremely creamy and soft, I love me some soft served ice cream and this is what it reminded me of except that it is more creamy! Thai Tea was really good and taste like you were eating a nice cold Thai Tea. 

The boyfriend thought that it wasn't a big deal and that it was over hyped and it is just ice cream and there was nothing special about it.
author: Mona L.

description: Tried their "kuhsterd" for the first time at off the grid of telegraph and i didnt really like it. First of all, it was too pricy for a dessert. Second of all, i guess i had a different interpretation of what frozen custard would be. This just tasted like an overpriced ice cream.
author: Cherry Y.

description:
I've always said, I can give up pasta, rice, but not my sweets. I mean...I did decide to go on an ice cream-venture to find the best ice cream shop along the Peninsula, so I would think I have some expertise right? :)

Frozen Kuhsterd to me is a combination of ice cream and gelato...very smooth, creamy, and such a delight. I am a big fan of the flavors, its toppings, and the customer service FK workers provides. Ask them what combination works best, and they won't hesitate to let you know. Of course they know how to create the perfect balance. I mean you would think that a bacon-pecan pie topped with blue bottle coffee kuhsterd, drizzled with condensed milk would be over the top, but what a masterpiece! Today, I double-fisted with a single scoop each of the ube and thai tea. Both were devoured within minutes! (Oink!)

Whenever FK is available on Gateway, rain or shine, I am there. I am looking to tasting more the flavors, and will make sure to order pints to go next time.
author: Eunice M.

description:
This place is the BOMB! 

Not only the people were nice and welcoming, but their custards were great! Many different flavors where you can't buy else where! 

*Handmade custards* 

My favorite flavor was the Thai tea custard (runs low at times causes its so popular!)

RECOMMEND!!
author: Kim C.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd boys are the best! They're so friendly and happy all the time maybe it's because they're making bomb ass ice cream all the time! I've had the cinnamon toast crunch ice cream with CTC on top- kinda tasted like cereal ice cream which is fine by me. I've also tried the plain ol' vanilla with chopped almonds- sometimes simplicity is the best. 

Only complaint is if you get a plain scoop of something then they put it in this tiny plastic container and the ice cream is practically spilling over the edge so if you don't eat it really fast then it starts to melt and get pretty messy.  If you get something with toppings it comes in a plastic cup so you're good there.
author: Jojo L.

description:
This is hands down the best frozen dessert of any kind in San Francisco, and possibly the best customer service in the city. Besides that,t he owners are awesome and down to Earth, they love to chat if they have time. There really is nothing negative to say about them except that you can't buy it on every corner, haha.

Every single thing I have tried here has been amazing, but in particular I recommend the hot cola float, it's very unique and the heat changes the flavor and texture considerably, it's almost like an herbal drink. If you're a fan on Fernet you would almost definitely like it. Hey, maybe that can be another flavor for them to try...
author: Joshua B.

description: I tried this place at the recent yelp event I went to and what is there left to say that other yelpers left out- nothing besides *insert some cheesy/ corny line that defines the pure goodness this place is. I had the crack pie custard and omg it's almost better than the actual thing. I was so impressed and I am seriously thinking of renting their truck or stand out for my graduation brunch ( it's not everyday a Black woman earns her masters- so why not celebrate big with some custard, right?) Plus the owner was super nice and down to earth, what's not to love!
author: Desiree C.

description:
Wow. We've had custard in Milwaukee (supposedly the home of custard ), but this blows it away. Thai Ice Tea Custard, Chocolate Malt Custard, Strawberry Custard -- and that was just one day's menu.

Find their truck in the Off-The-Grid directory or at their web site, and hunt them down !
author: Richard H.

description:
Although I have yet to try his awesome creations straight from the truck (**sad face**) I HAVE got to try several flavors available at Ssisso, and I am a HUUUUUUUGE fan! Seriously, I don't rave about things, but I will tell anyone and EVERYONE about Frozen Kuhsterd and his awesome creations!

To date I have sampled:
-black sesame
-espresso (or some coffee/mocha flavor)
-avocado
-Cinnamon toast crunch

They have all been unique, flavorful, and DELICIOUS! Very creamy, but not so heavy feeling. I personally have been a fan of the black sesame and the avocado, which is interesting because I'm usually all about flavors that are going to be full of boldness (like the cinnamon toast crunch one). 

Anyway, if you stumble upon his creations somewhere, get some FAST and be prepared for a real treat!
author: Courtney S.

description:
Went Yesterday had the smores sunday 6.50. It was OK, nothing out of the ordinary or anything I would go WOW about.  Limited choice of flavors in pleasanton. The service staff was very friendly. I would have to say that I wouldn't go out of my way to try this place again and I might go elsewhere because it wasn't worth 6.50 so alittle pricey.

all in all an ok experience
author: Dave O.

description: When I heard "frozen custard", I imagined something different, but it turned out to be regular ice cream. But they do have some great flavors! I tried the banana rum and liked it.
author: Hema R.

description:
The truck parked at my workplace today and MAN, was that an awesome surprise! I had a cupcake sundae - Horchata cupcake, cereal milk custard, and burnt caramel sauce. Well worth that extra couple of miles I'm going to run today ;)
Frozen Kuhsterd, you rock!
author: Anne S.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMM

Frozen Kuhsterd came to the Eat Real Festival in Oakland, and my roommate and I made sure to come by! I was super looking forward to their blue bottle coffee, but they gave the last scoop to someone right in front of me. :(((( 

Amongst the three of us, we got a scoop of vanilla, cinnamon toast crunch, and the bacon waffle sundae! Yummmm! The frozen custard is the PERFECT consistency: it's soft but thick and creamy. Sooooo good! The vanilla was really yummy, and cinnamon toast crunch seriously (cereally??) tasted like cereal! Sooo good! Their custard is also like the perfect sweetness!

The bacon sundae was also good! The bacon is cooked into the waffle, which is served with a scoop of vanilla on top. The waffle was kind of hard, and a little difficult to eat. Would probably pass on this and just get the custard on its own next time.

Can't wait to be back!
author: Stephanie W.

description: The GF and I came here and ordered the Boba Guys' Sundae.  I have to say that my mind was already made up about this place when I noticed that the sundae had boba made from Boba Guys.  (See my Boba Guys review).  The tiny $7 sundae just did not hit the spot for me.  I would have preferred to buy a pint of ice cream from Safeway. :( .  The black sesame ice cream was okay tasting.  The boba killed it for this sundae though, and not in any good way.  The boba was bland, for lack of a better word.  I would not come back here.  I am sorry my fellow Yelpers.  I do not agree with the high ratings.  Haters gonna hate on this post... I know it.
author: Victor L.

description:
Getting carded to buy ice cream?  Priceless.  

At SOMA Streat Food Park on Cinco de Mayo the only flavor they had left was Resposado Tequila.  Each scoop ($3.50 per) contained 1/3 shot of resposado tequila and yeah, they were checking i.d.s.  

This stuff was great.  This is the 2nd time I've had Frozen Khusterd's product and I liked it equally both times.  Much better than Humphrey Slocombe, in my opinion.  Discounts on multiple scoops in a single cup or cone.  I had to go single scoop, designated driver y'all.
author: James A.

description:
I approached this food truck wanting to try the most unique flavor and ended up getting "frosted flake cereal milk". The taste was spot-on. Truly did taste like the milk left over after eating frosted flakes haha. It is much creamier than icecream thats for sure. 
I'm an icecream LOVER. I work at a icecream store...I eat it everyday. ALthough it was more creamy, I would not pay the price again. I think i was around $4 for a single scoop with no toppings? It was a good experience though.
author: Jessica A.

description: Don't know if I just caught this truck on a bad day, but it definitely did not live up to the hype. I was disappointed that they didn't have more interesting flavors like kettle popcorn and cinnamon toast crunch custard that they had listed on their website. Instead, I had to settle for a plain dark chocolate with a boring topping. I really love frozen custard, but the consistency was not as rich and creamy as the other custards i had tried in the past. Overall, I was underwhelmed.
author: Arathi S.

description: The chocolate float is cold, creamy and delicious. They do a really good job of maintaining the quality of their frozen desserts--if it had been served to me at my office, I would never have known it came from a food truck.
author: Josephine L.

description:
Fantastic. I had the Corn Flake Cereal custard with oreos, sprinkles, and caramel. It was every bit as fantastic as it sounds.

So good.
author: Jeff W.

description:
All my friends know I LOVE my sweets, like LOVE. I can have the biggest dinner, but still make room for delicious dessert! AND NOW YOU KNOW TOO. :)

I am on the constant search for the best dessert in San Francisco. I finally got the chance to try Frozen Kusterd and I FELL IN LOVE. If you haven't tried it yet... you better go find their truck! I guarantee you will fall in love too. Yes, I guarantee. 

I am a sucker for cheesecake AND it just so happen that they had a cheesecake flavor with the graham cracker chunks on the bottom. (drool)! I got a chance to talk to the owner and found out that all their ingredients are local, organic, and natural!! Delicious with natural ingredients?! I am SOLD. :)

You know what.. don't take my word for it.. GO try it and see for yourself.. When you realize I was correct, come back and thank me ;)
author: Kalok L.

description:
When it comes to frozen, creamy dessert I don't really discriminate. I will eat a tub of generic supermarket ice cream but can also appreciate artisan ice creams as a special treat. I'll also admit that I don't taste a huge difference between frozen custard and ice cream. 

But what makes me dream about Frozen Kuhsterd are their creative flavors and smart sundae combinations. Their custards like Cereal Milk, Dirty Chai, and Burnt Caramel can stand on their own. But when I have dessert, I want the whole shebang. The first time I tried them at the Asian Street Festival in the TL, I tried the cereal milk sundae with condensed milk and cinnamon toast crunch and thought that would be my fave but I was blown away with the one with azuki beans and matcha syrup. The balance of flavors was perfect. 

At the Eat Real Festival, I tried their interpretation of halo halo with custard atop flan with puffed rice - I need the crunch. I love liege waffles so this sundae with a mini bacon waffle is really what convinced me to stop by the ERF. It did not disappoint. 

I'm so over most mediocre food trucks and food concepts that just pile creamy, rich crap on top of fried grease. These guys know what they're doing and I will continue to stalk them. Smart to collaborate with local bakers for baked goods to pair with the custard. Wish I'd tasted their ice cream sandwiches with pandan cookies and kouign amann (next big French pastry to hit the US...forreals).
author: Mimi L.

description:
YUMMY!! I'm hooked!! Everytime the truck is in my area we are there!! Sometimes I feel like a stalker!! 

Thai Milk tea with condensed milk and honey grahams or Four Barrel Coffee with Burnt Caramel or a Coffee donut with four barrel coffee and condensed milk OMG I could go on and on with the combinations...they are ALL DELISH!! 

Jason and Alex are so friendly and I feel like I've known them FOREVER!!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
What I ate: Frozen custard!
Visit date: January 13, 2012
First time? Yes.

I had never had frozen custard before...until now! I didn't know what to expect, but I was pleasantly intrigued. Two flavors were served; I tried both. :)
The Buena Vista is like an Irish Coffee -- made with Blue Bottle coffee and Jameson Irish Whiskey. Oowee. Here's your alcohol fix for the day (a bit too strong for my taste). The Jameson makes the consistency a bit like a slightly melted froyo.
The Cinnamon Toast Crunch -- tastes just like cereal and milk topped with a Cinnamon Toast Crunch crumble. This flavor was more my style. It was creamier and the cereal topping added a nice texture. Another helping please. 

PS I tried Frozen Kuhsterd at a Yelp event. I'm not sure where they'll turn up next, but watch for them! You won't be disappointed!
author: Erin G.

description:
I was pretty much expecting this to taste like regular ice cream. I had low expectations which is why I opted out of the toppings and just got one scoop of plain ol' vanilla. I figured if I didn't like their most basic custard then I'd probably not like the others. Boy, was I wrong! I don't really know how to describe the taste. Not your run of the mill ice cream or froyo. Kind of like leche flan for all my fellow Filipinos but not exactly. It's its own hybrid. 

Can't pin point the taste, all I know is that it's on point. See what I did there? 

Definitely trying the different variations next time I encounter this baybeh. Thumbs up!
author: Abigail D.

description:
Thai tea frozen custard! Man, i love frozen custard and I love thai tea! i was this close to getting the sundae that added boba and almond jelly onto it... It'd be like a frozen milk tea ya know? 

I didn't (and I still regret it) but I topped my thai tea frozen custard with corn flakes instead and that was yummy. The custard had a really strong thai tea flavor - I love that they don't hold back.

My one gripe comes with the texture  - if you're used to frozen custard from Texas... this lacks the smooth, velvety, and dense consistency that I've come to associate with frozen custard. I'm gonna describe it, so bear with me - but frozen custard should be like super dense soft serve ice cream. Like soft serve gelato, ya know? This just felt like - normal ice cream... but delicious! 

Overall though, this was a very enjoyable scoop of a frozen treat that's almost like frozen custard but not quite. Check it out!
author: Karina G.

description:
Ever since I heard about Frozen Kuhsterd, I've been scratching my head. "Wha? Is that like an egg tart frozen? Are they served in little dishes?" I really didn't know what frozen custards were, my closest encounter with them would be the Concretes at Shake Shack in NYC. ANYWAY.

To answer your question, frozen custard is pretty much like ice cream. Like denser, creamier, richer, melts in your mouth but not as fast as ice cream. Meaning, it's like the butter of ice cream. Mmmmm. Butter.

As a ice-creamy desserts fanatic, I especially love ice-cream brands that like to be adventurous and come up with new flavors all the time. Like your staples? Frozen Kuhsterd's Cereal Milk got the tasty factor on lock! Light in flavor, not too sweet, smooth texture. I would love this in an Affogato (idea guys!)  

I can't wait to hit them up again to try their Thai Tea, Chocolate Malt, parfait sundaes and ice cream sandwiches. Hope they'll be around a lot more now that they have a truck!
author: Faffy L.

description: Frozen Khusterd was at our schools Centennial celebration and I got the joy of trying their delicious custard.  My daughters couldn't get enough of the s'mores sundae and haven't stopped asking me when we will be going back.  The owner Jason is such a great guy so make sure to visit Frozen Khusterd.
author: Meghan G.

description:
I was pretty excited to come across this truck at Off the Grid Serramonte since I always heard about how delicious frozen custard is. 

The line was about 20 minutes long (which was fine since that's usually a good sign) but by the time we got to the front they were sold out of several of the custards and toppings. I was really hoping to try their boba so that was a bit of a disappointment. 

Anyway I ended up getting two scoops of their four barrel coffee flavor with the burnt caramel topping ($5.50). The custard itself was very creamy (it reminded me of Mitchell's Ice Cream) but I didn't find it that flavorful compared to something you might get elsewhere. On the other hand, the caramel topping was delicious, definitely my favorite part. 

I'm determined to try their boba so I'll definitely be back to try more.
author: Cara K.

description:
Avocado oh so good!

The guys were so nice letting me try all of the flavors. And then I expressed my enthusiasm for seeing them in their truck so they gave me a box of mini cupcakes to share with my office! we're fans :D

Please come back to mint plaza!
author: Julia P.

description: Simply delicious.  Interesting flavors, interesting toppings, and reasonable prices.  The coffee custard I had was excellent, with burnt caramel topping.  I hope to see them again at the StreatFood Park- will return for sure when my sweet-tooth gets the better of me again!
author: Andy S.

description: Thai Iced Tea - in a word, delicious! Smooth, velvety flavor that wasn't too sweet. Would love to try out other flavors the next time I patron Off the Grid!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
I had my first taste of frozen custard a few years ago when I was living in Seattle and I was really sad when I moved here and SF didn't really have any frozen custard places.  Lo and behold the boyfriend and I discovered that Frozen Kuhsterd existed last weekend.  Fast forward to this weekend and we were at the Treasure Island Flea Market and what do we see but the Frozen Kuhsterd food truck.

I got a double scoop of the vanilla and we enjoyed it under the shade of a tree.  It was a little icy, but the flavors were really good.  I'm a little disappointed about the amount I got, I kind of feel like the scoops could be bigger (2 scoops for 5 bucks) but I'm not going to complain about it either.

It wasn't as good as the place in Seattle, but it still hit the spot.  I would definitely get some more if I saw them around town (but I doubt I'd seek them out either).
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
This place is so amazing! I think it's my first time having custard. 

We found it at the SOMA Food Truck Park today. No line. A little pricey.

We got the Maple Bacon Glazed Donut over Four Barrel Coffee custard with Burnt Caramel drizzled over it. So freakin good!

Definitely try it out.
author: Jack K.

description:
Really fantastic coffee flavor in the custard.  Also, the custard itself is delightfully rich and creamy, without being overly sugary.  

Fantastic experience.
author: Di Yin L.

description: Frozen Kuhsterd was serving up four flavors today at OTG Pleasanton and I ordered a scoop of the Guittard Chocolate. It was a flavor I hadn't ordered before and it was good. My only minor complaint was the icy texture of the Kuhsterd. I'm used to it being creamy (cuz it usually is), but today's batch of chocolate had an icy texture.
author: D B.

description:
Tried the dark chocolate stout beer and honey graham cracker flavors served by a couple of not bad looking Flips today at Yelp's Beerwalk Empire.  Who knew that Filipinos are the masterminds behind this East Coast and Midwestern dessert?  

While I'm by no means blown away by these particular flavors, I'm definitely intrigued to try their creative and unique flavors.  The dark chocolate beer stout tasted like chocolate, and the honey graham cracker flavor was overwhelmingly honey, though the graham cracker crumble added a nice contrasting texture.  Will have to stop by their shop if I'm ever in their neck of the wood.  Or better yet, hopefully their mobile food truck will make it out to the East Bay to garner some more fans on this side of the bay.
author: My H.

description: Today Frozen Kuhsterd came to my old school and I just HAD to visit and get one. I had ordered the Thai Tea "kuhsterd" with a maple bacon donut drizzled with burnt caramel. It was AMAZING. I am a HUGE fan of Thai Tea and the flavor of the drink was perfect in the kuhsterd. The sweet and salty combo was just perfect. I will totally come visit the truck some day when I am in the city. I am dying to try their boba sundae in collaboration with Boba Guys.
author: Tiffany T.

description: I don't get it.. Why is this place so hyped up? I waited in line for about an hour for this at the jack london square street fair. I thought that it would be amazing since everyone was in line for it. But sadly it really wasn't that great. I mean don't get me wrong it was good but not what I expected. It was a out $4 for a really small cup of pretty much ice cream.  Totally not worth it. It was also REALLY SWEET..too sweet for my taste.
author: Nguyet T.

description: i was able to give them a try at the eat real festival in 2012.  i ordered vanilla custard over a bacon waffle, and i was immediately in love.  its superrrr creamy!  the custard in addition to the waffle gave it the perfect touch.  i cant wait until i encounter this truck again!
author: mong linh n.

description: We saw them in front of the Ferry Building. It was cold but because we were bundled up, a frozen kusterd sounded awesome. The server was friendly and approachable, he was very patient with us as we had a few samples before making our purchase. We got the Vanilla Beam with Cinnamon Toast Crunch topping. Their vanilla bean was delicious! We would get it again. If only you guys can come down to SoCal!
author: Stefanie H.

description:
You know when you have a bowl of cereal and your milk takes on this amazing 'no longer just milk' taste? The cereal milk that remains is the best bit of a bowl of cereal, right? Just me then? No, you're the weirdos! 

In any case I tried Frozen Kuhsterd's Cereal Milk offering and it was a taste explosion in my mouth. It could be the best frozen dairy dessert I've ever had. It was closely followed by their mocha flavour. 

Don't think about it. Just do it. Your mouth will thank you. I can't guarantee your waistline will say the same...
author: Lani P.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd Kusterhd Kuhsterhd, no matter how many times I eat you I will keep misspelling your misspelled name. This is the one truck I consistently look for now on vendor lists for the billion food truck gatherings that now occur in the Bay. Because I'm always hunting for sweets and this wins big in the dessert truck world. And the Creme Brulee Shop is now three steps from where I work.

The first time I had them was actually at Suika, and it's nice that they have places where you can always find them. There I had the thai iced tea, and this was the first week Suika was open, so the guy was generous and threw in some boba for me. The ice cream (that's basically what it is) was amazing. The texture and the flavor blew me away. I was hoping for similarly strong and unique flavors from the truck, but at least when I went at Oakland First Fridays, all they were offering was coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Slightly disappointed, until I ate them. My friend and I ordered the "Napa style", ie vanilla with sea salt and caramel, and a Four Barrel coffee with oreo and burnt caramel toppings per the guy's recommendation. I loved them both. Don't knock Napa style til you've tried it! My friends still felt it was a little unusual and too strong on the olive oil, but I thoroughly enjoyed, and finished, it...The coffee with the toppings was awesome, highly recommended combination.

The small size was plenty big, but the price is still a bit high, especially when you consider that toppings are 50cents each. And note that most of the pictures are of combinations people put together themselves. Even if it's a set, recommended combination, you still pay the full premium for the toppings.
author: Jennifer H.
