description: The Blue Bottle Coffee flavor was pretty darn tasty for all you coffee lovers out there! Although, I must say, I didn't get the "custard" part  - all I saw and tasted was ice cream? Don't question it, just enjoy it.
author: Mansi A.

description:
I really think these guys got it down.  The "Kuhsterd" is super smooth and the temp was just perfect.  just cold enough to enjoy yet not freezing where you have to worry about a brain freeze. I had their product when they first opened and it was good and different but it seems like these guys finally mastered it. Great product, great flavors (they have tons to choose from) and most importantly great people running the business.  Hopefully they can open up a store so I do not have to keep chasing down their truck! Keep it up! 

The coffee "Kuhsterd" is a must try! You can still smell the freshness of the coffee beans!
author: Robin n.

description:
Eh.  Definitely not better than ice cream but they have an interesting idea.  I was surprised at the taste of the custard and couldn't decide if I actually liked it or not.  I was a little blue that I didn't find Mr. Blue to be as amazing as everyone said it would be.  

They were at the SF Mad Dash and their flavors were very limited.  For my first cheat treat after running the 5K, I got vanilla bean with caramel and cinnamon toast crunch.  My FAVORITE cereal!  All 3 flavors blended nicely but there was something weird about the custard.  I can't quite put my finger on it but it threw me off a bit and I didn't want to waste any more calories eating it.  I wasn't wasting much because their portions are so tiny.  And for the price!  Talk about highway robbery.  $7 for about 1/2 a scoop of custard, I squirt of caramel and 1 tablespoon cinnamon toast crunch.  The portions were prefect actually but not for the price.  Either lower the price with the same portions of give more portions for the same price.

I give them 3 stars for now because I only had one flavor and would really like to try their other flavors, like the mint flavor.  The idea of the custard ice cream is really new to me so I think it's going to take some getting used too.  I'm willing to give Mr. Blue another chance if he doesn't make me blue again.
author: Victoria C.

description:
I finally got to try this a few weeks ago at G Food Lounge and it did not disappoint! I had the Thai tea flavor with condensed milk; it was kind of amazing. It's really rich and creamy so be prepared, especially if you've just had a huge meal. 

You can sample any flavor, so if you're not sure what you want, just ask to try something. 

I'll be back!
author: Nadia S.

description:
FROZEN CUSTARD IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!
WOOOOOHOOOOOOO
i hope they make it big!!
i have no idea how california claims to have happy cows yet barely anyone here knows what frozen custard is!
author: beth m.

description:
My sister made me.

And I liked it...! Service was nice, these guys are pretty nice dudes. I was suppose to check in for the free topping deal but they said I didn't need to, but I did! 

I deserved 2 toppings but I was pretty sure I was pushing it. Cool dudes. Cool, cool, cool.
author: Karry D.

description: Got the Vanilla with burned caramel at the Treasure Island Flea Market today. Sooooooooo good.
author: Kajal G.

description:
After standing about forty minutes in line it was somewhat worth it. I had a bacon waffle with a scoop of vanilla custard and burnt caramel sauce. The custard is as expected - good. Tasty stuff with good consistency. If it's a hot day it will melt quickly. The caramel sauce is done very well and adds to the tastiness. The flavor of the bacon waffle turned out better than I expected. It's pretty salty but if you eat everything together it's somewhat magical.

My biggest gripe would be the freshness of the waffle. The waffle was REALLY stale. It's a leige waffle so I wasn't expecting anything airy, but I couldn't even cut it with the given spoon. I ended up having to eat it with my hand. If something isn't fresh they should just take it off the menu. I would have rather just gone with two scoops of custard than the waffle option. Oh and my last gripe would be the portion size. It's rather small for $3 you get less than a 1/4 full of a plastic cup.

The organization within the truck was ridiculous. The workers were looking at tickets super confused and disorganized like they have never done it before. Simplify the menu and organize your food line. There's no reason why it should have gone that slow for custard that's already made and needs only one or two toppings.
author: Michael H.

description:
Who knew kuhsterd could be so good!!! no seriously...the pumpkin cheesecake rendition I had at the Yelp Elite event was absolutely scrrummppptious!!! It was so legit it tasted like I was eating pumpkin cheesecake ice cream! It wasn't too heavy and the graham cracker bits added just the right about of texture. 

Their logo is absolutely adorable too!! Good job guys!! :)
author: Kristen C.

description:
The first time I tried this truck I was not impressed at all, but it must have just been an off night because since then I have been back MANY times and have had nothing but delicious custard! The s'mores sundae is my absolute favorite, the gram cracked cereal is totally perfect on it! 
And the cookie butter flavor... I can't even describe it's deliciousness. Definitely a truck to visit!
author: Rachel S.

description: friendly service, though i cant really tell it apart from ice cream, interesting consistency, creamy, sweet (but not everyone will like the sweetness).
author: Long C.

description:
Mmmmmm.

First, I'm an east coast girl who loves custard.  And it's damn hard to find out here.  And when you do find it, it blows.  So I'm so happy to finally find some good custard around.

I had the pleasure of trying Frozen Khusterd out last night at a Yelp Elite event and just like Jane A, I too became a Facebook and Twitter follower/stalker.  And we're not the only ones.  So clearly its not us, it's them, and in the best sense.

I tried their Spiked Cereal Mix with Jameson.  Alcohol can be a tricky ingredient to work with, but I tried it anyways and they mastered it perfectly in this recipe.  It wasn't over powering and didn't mess up the consistency.  It was light, creamy and had a hint of a kick to it.  Sold!  I wish I could have taken a pint home, I already know of a few people who would love this stuff.  I hope to see them around again and more frequently, even if summer is ending.  Because custard is perfect all year round, no matter how cold it gets.
author: Jen K.

description:
Dee-lish!

If you're an ice cream lover, than you will absolutely adore Frozen Kuhsterd! The flavors are unique and on point. My favorite by far is the cinnamon toast crunch, mainly because that's my all time favorite cereal! :)  It's insanely yummy! I can't wait to try all their other flavors!
author: meems k.

description:
Always happy to see Frozen Kuhsterd the most amazing and creative flavor
It is delicious I can't wait totry it again!
author: Wendy N.

description: Love this truck and their fun flavors! My favorites are the cereal milk and thai tea custards. I usually order them in a boba sundae or with some silvanas. Staff is so friendly and don't mind if you request several samples to try new flavors :)
author: Krizia M.

description:
this is hand's down the best frozen custard that I've ever had in the history of the world. and the only flavor that I have consistently ordered was vanilla.

my husband and I first tried the frozen custard at off the grid across from the ferry building and we've been fans ever since.

frozen kuhsterd people, if you so happen to see this, do you sell this deliciousness in gallon form? I will bring my own container, pretty please.
author: Le E.

description:
More KUHSTERD please!!! I had probably at least four scoops at the Yelp Holiday Hangover last Friday. It was by far my most favorite thing there. The Buena Vista (Irish Coffee) flavor was super delish, nothing like a shot of Bailey's (groossss) but it had a rich Blue Bottle coffee and Jameson flavor that was so perfect and way better than the drinks they were serving at the bar. 
The Cinnamon Toast Crunch was superb as well, the kuhsterd was so creamy and smooth with the bits of cinnamon toast crunchies on top! Such an inspired combination of flavors and textures.
Now I just need to know where I can devour all of the kuhsterd for all the days there aren't Yelp parties in my life.
author: Mary Ella D.

description:
I tried their booth at the "Jet, Set, Fete" Yelp Elite event on Sunday and must say that I am now a fan of frozen custard! I am usually a sorbet/frozen yogurt kind of person but after trying the store's crowd favorite, Cereal Milk, I'm going to add custard to the list too!

Honestly, custard doesn't taste all too different from regular ice cream, except it's less thick and rich. All the sweetness and flavor without the extra calories I guess!

I met Jason at the event and he was super nice, letting us try all the flavors and telling us how he got started and what the flavors were all about. 

Not to be too redundant, but my absolute favorite of the night was Cereal Milk. It's topped with an unknown brand of corn flakes...but I was really hoping they'd put some condensed milk on there too! However, that was only reserved for the avocado flavor :(.

Anyway, Frozen Kuhsterd's custard is a nice change of pace from the regular desserts that I'm used to consuming. Check them out if you want to try something different - you won't regret it!
author: Chival N.

description:
Spiked cereal milk.......if you haven't had it, you better find these guys and get some!!!!

I ran into Frozen Kuhsterd at last night's Yelp Elite 'Back to Cool' event.  Hmm...I've heard of ice cream, frozen yogurt but never Frozen Khusterd and if Khusterd really means custard in plain English spelling then I'll be dammed.....cuz I love custard.  And if I wasn't lactose intolerant I would've came back for seconds and thirds and fourths LOL.  

The taste was definitely there and it was overpowering or to creamy.....it was just right =) The other flavor they had was cookies n' cream and that was actually real good too but I fell in love with the Spiked cereal milk.  Jameson in khusterd.....man you guys are geniuses!!!  No I'm not an alcoholic but if you gave me about 2-3 cups a day of this I think I'd pass to say that I am one.  Hmmm....I wonder what alcoholic Kuhsterd they'll think of next.  Make sure to hit me and Joraine G. up....cuz we'll be your taste testers LOL.  

Oh and my last note, you guys need to pair up with Dash Cafe and their caramel waffle pretzel looking things....they went together quite well!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: I love me some Frozen Khusterdddd. Mmm. This is defs a dessert food truck must try! Always left satisfied :P
author: Krystal O.

description:
These guys have something really special going for them and that is texture. Totally creamy with just that nice film of succulent fat that you might expect from a delicate truffle or something. I'm krazy about their flavors like four barrel and cereal milk and i cannot wait to see what other krazy concoctions these guys will produce.  

My only :( is that they are in SF and not in the bay but hopefully someday peeps in the yay can also experience this delectable treat!
author: Seb M.

description: Jason and his team are great!  They came into our office to serve ice cream during our ice cream social and did a fantastic job!  They brought in Cereal Milk (it really taste like it!) and Blue Bottle Coffee flavored ice cream.  Both flavors were delicious!  thanks guys!
author: YUMM E.

description: oh my MY yummy!!!  I follow this truck everywhere!  I love the four barrel coffee with burnt caramel!  Jason and his crew are awesome and so friendly.  I am so happy they are busy!  Best dessert truck!  Thank you for coming to the Bay!
author: K B.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd - somewhere between gelato and ice cream, but with a lot more egg. The texture . Very smooth and creamy! I know it's on the East Coast, so it's about time that frozen custard made its way over here.

I recently tried the Four Barrel and Mexican Chocolate. Both flavors were delicious and when it came to the Mexican Chocolate, it delivered a nice punch to the back of your throat. Loved their interpretation of Mexican Hot Chocolate.

You can find them at the Underground Market and through their Twitter account. 

I wonder if they are looking for taste testers! :P
author: Tinna H.

description:
Frozen khusterd is my go to dessert after taking my lady and daughter out to eat. I gotta have the Yuzu Saki. Its just the right amount of Saki!
My girl who has me drive to dessert places all over the city loves the Salted Caramel w/ coffee swirl. My daughter loves the Cereal Milk. Find out what your missing out on!
author: andrew m.

description:
Desserts? I have another stomach for em! My old review just didn't do it justice. It's been over two years and the heart and soul of FK remains the same. With their ever-growing number of flavors, you're bound to fall in love with one, if not all. I'm a creature of habit, so my go-to would have to be the Spiked Cereal Milk. Booze is clearly the answer to everything. They've since expanded to custard in donuts, boba w/ custard, and even don bugito custard... I may have to draw the line there, but for those adventurous eaters -- do it. I mean, who am I to judge.. I would love if they had a durian flavored custard, but I think that's just wishful thinking.

I had one of those days where I thought I'd get a small and it would suffice. Wrong. It was a hot day at the Maker Faire in San Mateo. I knew FK was vending nearby, so I made my rounds and ended up at their tent. After finishing the first one, I wandered around a little bit more, but there was no denying I'd go back. I think it was Four Barrel that day.. Satisfaction was equal to and/or greater than Shame. 

These guys love what they're doing, and want to create the best. Also that custard logo.. cutest custard guy.. nom nom nom.. oops.
author: Donna H.

description: Love their flavors, especially the four barrel coffee with condensed milk. Seasonal flavors, like the pumpkin chocolate are excellent, highly recommend
author: Dy M.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd's logo is adorable which isn't important info to know, but good job for standing out (and I bet it has no problem catching the ladies' attention)! 

My friend and I bought a pint of the Four Barrel flavored custard at the Underground Food Market. I figured we were the first of the night to do so because all three guys surprisingly said "woah" when I ordered it lol. Anyway, I loved how delicious and strong the Four Barrel tasted. I can't see how anyone could NOT like it. 

We opened up sharing the pint with two other friends. Between the four of us, we couldn't finish it! Custard uses more eggs to make than ice cream! And you really don't need to buy an entire pint like we did to get satisfaction.
author: Bets Y.

description: Had my first taste of Frozen Kuhsterd at their booth during Eat Real in Oakland. The cookie butter custard - SO good. It was rich and creamy (like a custard), and was surprisingly not heavy. A fulfilling, unique dessert.
author: Krystine D.

description:
I had a sampling of their Mexican Chocolate and Four Barrel Coffee yesterday at a Loopt event, and I must say, it was absolutely superb! I'm from the midwest and have not had frozen custard in over 6 years, and this really took me back. This is the REAL THING people, go out and try it if you get the chance. 

If you've never had frozen custard, it's incredibly creamy and delicious. The texture was perfect, and the flavors were divine! The Mexican Chocolate had a bit of a kick at the end, but it was not overpowering. The Four Barrel Coffee was amazeballs, I'm craving for some right now...

Hurry up and open a storefront! :-)
author: Dexter C.

description:
Hi my name is Gwen but my friends call me Sweetie, because of my predilection to diabetes-inducing foods. Therefore, you know an item is too sweet if even I think so. I had high hopes for FK given the 4.5 stars and multiple reviews. After one failed attempt at trying this food truck at SOMA, I was finally able to make a date for this place when it was at Off the Grid: Serramonte. I started the trek by creating room in my tummy. This began with the idea to run two laps around Lake Merced and ended with one lap around LM. I braved the cold and wind standing in line to order the match sundae, which included green tea syrup, red beans, whipped cream, and your choice of custard. I chose the Thai iced tea flavor. Maybe it was the custard flavor that made the sundae too sweet but halfway through it, I had a fleeting thought that I should save the rest because of the sugar level. That rarely happens. 

Should I ever be nearby FK coincidentally, I'd give it another shot but I wouldn't seek it out by following the website for the truck's location.
author: Gwen L.

description: These guys are awesome. I grew up on frozen custard and own a custard shop myself, so I know custard. This is the real dea l-- proper continuous flow machine and all. They're flavors are innovative and creative. Love the Napa one--so fun and tasty. Keep up the great work FK!
author: Zoe M.

description:
Love the fresh, innovative and tasty frozen treats by these guys. 

The Spiked Cereal Milk is a creamier, more palatable version of  Humphry's Secret Breakfast. Me likes!

The guys that are behind this venture are super friendly and super fun too! Hey, do you expect any less from a company with such a cool logo?

Keep it up Frozen Kuhsterd.
author: Jackie G.

description:
So. Friggin'. Good. 

I consider myself an ice cream connoisseur, and am pretty critical when it comes to good ice cream. Some people compare frozen custard to ice cream, but I would compare it more to gelato. What is frozen custard you ask?

It's this creamy, rich frozen treat that is made with more egg yolks and less air than ice cream. And Frozen Kuhsterd takes it to a whole new level. This, my friends, is beyond just any old "ice cream." The texture is so amazingly smooth and creamy, and the flavors I've had are just delicious. They make only about 2 flavors at a time in small batches, so you can taste the real care and thought put into making this. I love how they always have one original-type of flavor, and then a new, creative one, like spicy mexican chocolate, or blue bottle coffee. OMG, I'm salivating just writing this....You know when something is real good when you are left thinking about it days after and crave it some more.

Too bad they don't have a store open yet, I think I need to go get me some more right now!
author: Emy s.

description: "what the hell is frozen custard?" was my first thought. I knew it was dessert so I had to get some on this blazin hot SF day. I opted to go simple with a scoop of vanilla bean. One of the guys suggested a burnt caramel topping and I was immediately sold. Delicious and the right balance of creamy goodness. I can't wait to try the other flavors!
author: Lisa N.

description: Am I just supposed to just go back to regular ice cream after this? Ben N Jerry's can suck it as far as I'm concerned.
author: Megan A.

description: This was a food truck, the first ever frozen custard i have ever tasted. And it was quite good! If you're in a creamy mood i really recommend this place to you! I had the cinammon toast crunch flavor and it was nice and thick, sweet but not too overwhelming and the cinnamon was light as well. The pricing is not bad at all and you get a cute sticker! The service is really fast and friendly too! Definitely a place worth going too!
author: Lena T.

description: OMG Amazing!  I grew up eating my mom's home made custard, but she didn't freeze it.  So, this is my first time to try it frozen, and oh yeah, I'm a huge fan!!  The graham cracker topping and bottoming (???) really drives it home.  The guys are super nice too and encouraged me to come back for seconds...  which I did.
author: Chloe M.

description: So I promised the guy running the truck that if I enjoyed his pick of custard bread pudding I would write a review... and was he RIGHT! I can taste it now... my tummy feels like itll explode because ive eaten so much but it would not matter... give me seconds... NOW!
author: Joe D.

description: "It's not ice cream, it's frozen KUHsterd" is what they told me, and well I think it's great! Finally had a chance to try them at the Haigh Ashbury Fair and I want to go back, but sadly they aren't always around when I need them. I had the coffee flavor with a light drizzle of condense milk and ohhh that was heaven. Not much to say beside go try it if you haven't. Prepare for the guilty pleasure.
author: Khanh L.

description:
nailed it.

oh gosh, i've had my eye on this wandering food truck for ages, so when i saw the cute lil kuhsterd cup on the truck at Pink Saturday tonight, i felt like i had struck gold. and i might have...at least in the sense that i felt richer when i left than when i came, because frozen kuhsterd more than satisfied every tastebud and coated every inch of my tummy in deliciousness without tapping too deep into my pockets like so many SF ice cream shops are apt to do.

okay, down to business. i was torn between the red velvet cake batter and the four barrel ice cream, so the super sweet gal in the truck let me have tastes of both! mmmmmmm creamy, hefty, and popping with flavor! both of them. this would be a tough decision, but i ended up with a kid sized coffee ice cream with crushed almonds on top. the serving was generous and for only $3 i got more ice cream for half the price of other wicked-outrageously priced ice cream trucks around SF.

my stomach is usually bottomless, but i was so satisfied after just that scoop + nuts on top that i didn't want much of anything else all night. SO SATISFIED. so happy. join me in this bliss and track their truck down. decadent. delicious. delightful. definite do.

also, holy smokes some of their sundaes and ice cream sandwiches looked like the most amazing type of amazing in the history of amazing things. i will bring a friend with me next time and we shall ingest massive quantities of kuhsterd awesomeness.

until then. until then.
author: Theresa P.

description:
This was insanely delicious. I literally devoured the entire cup of Thai Tea custard in less than a minute.  

The Thai tea flavor could maybe be a bit stronger, but the texture and the thickness of the custard was seriously ridiculous good.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.

I've had a lot of ice cream in my day, I prefer thick ice creams/ gelatos, and I would describe this as a really thick ice cream. Droool. 

The only thing I would change is that I wish the scoops were bigger.
author: Leslie T.

description: Frozen Kuhsterd is soooooo delicious. Whenever I see the truck pop up somewhere, I gotta go there. Thai tea and regular vanilla are the only ones I've tried, but are so creamy, just perfect sweetness, and delicious. They have unique toppings and flavors! Give it a try sometime :)
author: Natalie W.

description: Best in class for custard! They are always surprising me with new flavors. You must try the Boba Guys sundae.
author: B C.

description:
i love frozen custard!  i wanted to try this place for awhile but the timing never worked out.  so it was a total treat (...) to spot them at soma street food on valentines day!  i chose honey graham cereal milk with burnt caramel...yum!  plus the people working there were SO nice and didn't make me feel like a loser for checking in on yelp to claim my free topping.

can't wait to go back and try thai tea!
author: Christy C.

description: Today we tried the Smores with Vanilla ice cream. Overall it was just ok. Paying $7 for the dessert was steep for what you get. The vanilla custard was just average. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing however it was highly recommended by the girl who took the order.
author: Jerome H.

description: You can tell that their ice cream has quality.  Tried the cupcake sundae with vanilla bean and red velvet cupcake and it was so good! The texture of the ice cream almost reminded me of gelato!
author: Dee S.

description: I've had them a few times with all different flavors and they're pretty good. Some might be more on the sweet side depending on the flavor through, but when you pick the right one for you, it's good.
author: Annie D.

description:
Having lived in SF for almost 20 years, I am thrilled to see the new interest in frozen custard.  I am a native of St. Louis where frozen custard is legendary, not a novelty at all.

For it to even exist on the West Coast or SF is somewhat of a miracle.  I love Frozen Kuhsterd for that.  I do have a criticism, however.  The focus on quality needs to improve.  I noticed that there were ice crystals in my 4 barrel coffee 2 scoop.    Frozen custard should not have ice crystals.  Perhaps the focus should be on the quality of the mouth feel, not on coming up with new flavors.  At the legendary Ted Drewes in St. Louis, the smoothness quality is the focus.  The huge variety of topping options is what is supposed to jazz up frozen custard.

According to Ted Drewes' website, "By definition, frozen custard must have at least 10% butterfat and 1.4% eggyolk.  The amount of air, also known as overrun, truly separates frozen custard from traditional ice cream.  Frozen custard has 20% overrun or less.  This reduction of air is what give frozen custard its silky smooth texture."  http://www.teddrewes.com/sitecontent/dynamiccontent.aspx?pid=76&uid=D18D6B6C-7948-4C04-8F59-12F77F9F3F49 

Perhaps the key to quality is having it freshly made, rather than flash frozen or stored at sub-zero temperatures.  Could producing it on site inside the truck be possible, rather than transporting it from a production facility, which I understand Frozen Kuhsterd does?  

Custard is made by sending it from a refrigerated hopper through a valve into a freezing chamber lined with beaters. The frozen custard is pushed through (extruded) out the front of the special machine and into a waiting bucket, ready to be served. Because it is not held in the chamber, there is very little air, known as overrun, beaten into the custard. This low overrun creates the dense and creamy texture.

By comparison, soft-serve custards, yogurts, and ice creams are made using what is known as a batch freezer, where the mixture remains in the machine and the overrun is as much as 100%, causing ice crystals to form. Frozen custard should not have ice crystals.  (See also http://www.thedairygodmother.com/what-is-frozen-custard/).
author: A. N.

description: Frozen Kuhsterd....the newest and best thing out there! Their flavors are unique and quite tasty. The collaborations they do with other businesses is pretty genius. I had their Maple Bacon Donut(Dynamo) sandwich with Thai Tea Kuhsterd which I think was one of the best tasting desserts I've had in a LONG time! The staff was quite friendly. Owners Jason and Alex.....you guys are awesome!!!! Keep up the great work! Can't wait to try more of your delicious creations!!!
author: Manvil B.

description: The 5 stars goes to the original silvana + coffee custard sandwich!  Brownie points to the nice guy that told me about the secret menu not advertised.  $4 for one, $7 for two.  Compared to the Creme Brulee Cart and other dessert carts that cost a little more for smaller portions, this is actually a good price!  Looking forward to trying more flavors!
author: Mary Ann M.

description: I've tried various concoctions at events FK has been at, and have never been disappointed.  The white coffee flavor is currently my favorite, but I need to make it to SOMA Street food park so I can try the special boba drinks and sundaes that I keep seeing pictures of.
author: Seong P.

description: Had a coupon for a free custard, so my husband and I tried it out yesterday after lunch... SO good!! My husband was thrilled that this lil frozen custard shop was actually a food truck, so he was sold after sighting it a block away. I had the vanilla bean custard with strawberry sauce (actual sauce with whole strawberries) and condensed milk. The custard itself is super creamy and you can tell they use a lot of egg yolk from the richness of the flavor, much like creme brûlée. The strawberry sauce tasted homemade and I just flat out love condensed milk. My husband has the cinnamon custard which tasted exactly like cinnamon toast crunch cereal. He had caramel over his. Very good!
author: Kae H.

description: ok nicest guys ever. They were at the north beach farmer's market this weekend which was awesome. The guy that took the orders was mad nice and recommended some stuff. i tried the four barrel coffee and thai ice tea. Both were DELICIOUS but I got the thai iced tea with condensed milk which was also delicious. it is exactly what it should taste like in ice cream form. I wish they have the boba special though. I'll ahve to try that next time.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: This is the first time I have given five stars on Yelp.  But, Yelp says that five stars is "As good as it gets," and that is true of FK's frozen custard.  I love soft serve ice cream and I am often disappointed with the texture.  The frozen custard at FK has the perfect soft serve texture.  We tried potato chip custard with caramel sauce.  It was awsome and made me wonder why I ever waited in a line anywhere else.
author: Amber B.

description: Hands down my favorite dessert food truck.  My favorite is the Four Barrel Coffee- with or without the burnt caramel sauce. If you're a fan of Haagen-Daaz coffee ice cream, you'll probably like the Four Barrel Coffee custard. The Thai Tea is also really good.    Service is always super friendly and pleasant.
author: Lois B.

description: FINALLY got to try this super delicious treat at the 20th Street Fair. So happy I did. I had the spicy chocolate mini donut with the Four Barrel Coffee Custard and a drizzle of caramel sauce. SWOOOOOON......hope a brick and mortar shop is in your future or you have some mission establishments serving this seriously delicious delight on a regular basis soon. My physique might not need it but my mouth does.
author: holly B.

description:
Even if the custard wasn't delicious, I would still give them 5 stars!  These are just the nicest guys ever.  They make a point to greet customers and thank them for their business.  I always get a little TLC too since I have allergies. 

The custard though is delicious and they  have interesting and yummy combinations.  Who knew you could make avocado ice cream?!
author: Jessine S.

description: I grew up in Milwaukee, the mother of all frozen custards and this comes pretty close to the real deal.  Had a vanilla on New Year's day and really enjoyed the taste.  You guys need to open a shop.
author: Philip K.

description: The custard, while limited in flavor selection, is thick and creamy to near perfection. Toppings are a bit repetitive (four kinds of cereal, but no fruit or the like), and the pastries are occasionally a bit too dry. But the custard itself is worth walking miles for.
author: Gavin G.

description: My husband and I stopped by and had a sweet treat from Frozen Kuhsterd last night at the SOMA Street Food park. These guys are incredibly nice, friendly, and super helpful. They patiently explained some of their different treats and offered to let us try several different flavors. I've never had frozen custard before, and was pleasantly surprised by how yummy it tasted! We shared the donut/ice cream sandwich made from the Dynamo Donut guinness pear molasses donut with vanilla custard and the burnt caramel topping. Fabulous!
author: Lilia A.

description: Good ice cream and bunch of different varieties.
author: Jack J.

description: Vanilla with chocolate sauce, sprinkled with peanuts.  YUM!!!  You'd never think it was frozen custard.  It's like an extremely smooth ice cream, but richer.  Just try it.
author: Denise M.

description: Delicious custard. I had the coffee custard with oreos in it. MMMM will definitely stop every time I see that truck!
author: Sam L.

description: First, the guys who run this are creative, personable and professional. Second, they have taken the time to take what could be a very straightforward dessert and twist it to make it simply elegant. From the interactions, to the menu explanations to thge desserts themselves I look forward to when I see them again.
author: C K.

description: My schedule almost never overlaps with the FK truck but 5 stars just for the boba sundae
author: Kimberly N.

description: I like this truck. It adds an extra little dash of amazing to the already yummy "normal" custard. Their flavors are delish, my favorite was the spiked cereal.
author: Roxanne H.

description: I'm so glad they come down to the South Bay. It is the smoothest, creamiest ice cream. We've tried four barrel, cereal milk and kettle corn. All were fantastic. Their burnt caramel is a must try. The boba sundae with Thai tea is different but so so good. They also carry yummy cupcakes and donuts. What's not to love?
author: C G.

description:
The Frozen Kuhsterd is the most magical thing I have ever had the pleasure of tasting. My taste buds were having the time of their lives when I ordered the red velvet cupcake with vanilla kuhsterd topped with burnt caramel. 

MUST. HAVE. MORE.
author: Niki J.

description: my GF has been raving about how good REAL custard is and how I need to try it.  So she comes with me for a bay visit and we find this truck by accident, of course we have to try it.  And I am amazed at how I didn't know about real custard before! Their spiked cereal was AMAZING!!! I cannot stress it enough! GO GET SOME NOW!
author: Josey V.

description: Holy mother of pearl. Honey Graham Cracker frozen smooth creamy deliciousness!!!! That's all you have to know! I had the pleasure of tasting this delectable dessert for the gods at the Yelp event: Beerwalk Empire. So glad I had the chance to or I don't know when I would ever be able to find this gem. Now to hunt them down like a stalker and try more flavors.
author: My C.

description:
Finally made it out to try this truck.

DID NOT DISSAPOINT!

I got the Vanilla & Coffee with condensed milk topping.  

What you waiting for?
GO GET ONE!
author: Andy W.

description: Sensational treat. Got the cookies n cream with burnt caramel and sprinkles it was heavenly. Fel got chocolate with nutter butter. Wish I got more than 1 scoop! When oh when will you be back to oakland?
author: Natasha L.

description: I can't believe I still haven't given props to these guys, they are super nice and their frozen custard is the 1st I've ever tried and it's so BOMB! And don't forget to get the syrup topping!
author: Karen T.

description: Not too unlike ice cream, just a lot more dense and richer. We tried the cinnamon toast crunch and the vanilla with burnt caramel. Good stuff.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I was able to check out zee Frozen Kuhsterd the Yelp Elite Back to Cool opening party at Rickshaw Bags.  Me being me, I leapt at the chance to try the Jameson Irish Wiskey and Corn Flake flavor, which was quite nice, cool and light and fluffy, sweet but not too, and subtle.  I look forward to the chance to check out more of the yumminess, and I think you should too!
author: Bad Y.

description: I first tried Frozen Kuhsterd at a Yelp event at Rickshaw Bags last month. I was able to sample the spiked cereal and the cookies and creme. Super delicious. Both frozen custards were creamy and flavorful. Where can I pick up a pint to take home with me? Lol! I'm lookinf forward to seeing Frozen Kuhsterd at another event and to try other flavors. Two thumbs up!
author: Frances V.

description: This Kuhsterd is far better than ice cream and the flavors are perfectly crafted. I need to give this product a high score and two big thumbs up! Seriously I am not a fan of sweets but this isn't a typical dessert and it isn't anything you'll regret trying.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I didn't realize what I was missing till I tried their custard!

I had their Pumpkin Cheesecake today and I enjoyed every last bite @ the Yelp event: Haute for the Holidays at Bare by Tru. Bottom layer of graham crumble, frozen custard, and graham crumble sprinkled over the top. Not too sweet, just the way I like it.

The other frozen custards I've had before melted sort of quickly and were closer to soft serve, which I learned is not true frozen custard! The guys are super nice and knowledgeable.

FK custard looks like a plain old scoop of ice cream, but it doesn't melt as fast =D Don't you hate it when have to rush to finish your treat before it turns into a overly sweet puddle of mess!

No problem here :)
author: Angel L.

description: Oh, my, goodness. Looks like this is an up and coming food truck? Had this at the Yelperstitious Holiday Party and it was oh so GOOD. Had the Cinnamon Toast Crunch Cereal Milk version which was a dense, creamy, and delicious combination of flavors! It was topped with little bits of Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal, which added a whole other dimension of tastiness to this dessert. Missed out on their Buena Vista flavor, but I'd definitely go through the effort of trying to find them again. Now the only trouble is actually trying to find this food truck... :( Hope they have a larger presence in the Bay Area soon!
author: Denise C.

description: The honey gram cracker is amazing! It  has a very honey flavor and swirled honey crystals and gram crumbs. Delicious.
author: Michelle K.

description:
full disclosure, i know these guys. 

that doesnt take away from the integrity of this review. actually, like ive said many times before. i am much much more critcial of my friends. thats probably why i dont have too many.

so even though i know these guys very well,for one reason or another, i didnt sample their product for a very long time. maybe it was the fact im not much of a sweet tooth person. maybe im way too grey goosed out most of the time...

about a year after they had their first test runs, i had the pleasure of trying some.

dude. texture. texture. texture. im sure all sorts of flavors will come and go with these guys, but to me, the most significant thing about their the product was the texture....

and the taste? and the flavor? well, the first thing i thought after the first spoonful was, WOW i wish my s/o was here. she REALLY NEEDS TO TRY THIS! this is some freaking good stuff.
author: Euge L.

description: My brother traded a few of my mini quiches (two bites) for three scoops of Cereal Milk and three scoops of Four Barrel Coffee. Both were creamy, delicous and I felt like there was a party in my mouth. Awesome.
author: Mariebeth A.

description: Bought a pint of their cinnamon toast crunch cereal milk at the Asian Heritage Street Celebration.  Tastes exactly like cinnamon toast crunch goodness!
author: ML N.

description:
Frozen Kuhsterd....AMAZING!
The team came out to a do a catering event I attended recently.  I tried Frozen Kuhsterd for the first time...and i'm in loooove!  
Tried the Vanilla, Burnt Caramel and Thai Tea (!!!) flavors and all are so amazing.  I love the consistency (so creamy and smooth), flavor, freshness - topped it off with ground almonds and you are all set!

So yummy!!!
author: C L.

description: It's good but honestly nothing special. Portions are ridiculously small for the price and they were honestly kind of rude. I was ignored for the longest time while waiting in line while they were chit chatting. I don't like to complain but you can at least acknowledge your customers and tell them you'll be with them in a bit. It's super expensive and overpriced and portions are stupid small. It's good but not worth the price
author: Jewlz L.

description: It was good... but it tasted like soft serve. It didn't wow me. I'm not sure what to hype is. They must have really good branding!
author: Anne L.

description: I ran into Frozen Kuhsterd by sheer luck!  But my next visit will be strategically planned!  I live in the South Bay so I'm already watching where I can go to get my next fix.  Born and raised in New York City, I'm pretty fussy about custard.  I tried the frozen kuhsterd donut bread pudding or something like that.  It was amazing!  I'll be back!
author: Merryl K.

description: delish custard/ice cream at streeat eats :) wish they had more flavors but all that was left was the cinnamon toast crunch which was very tasty
author: Nicole S.

description: never again - $3.50 for a small scoop of vanilla custard that did not taste any better than a cheap supermarket ice cream plus there were ICE crystals in it.
author: Nadia Geddi T.

description: hello, before off the grid came to Serramonte daly city, the nearest food truck market was at san mateo caltrain, one of my favorite ice creams was the thai tea frozen custard with peanuts and I still really want the recipe from the owners, the owner said he would email me sometime when he has time, so but it was the best thai tea ice cream I ever had! these things are a trend for a foodie
author: Ava R.

description: just tried their thai tea flavor today and it was unspeakably divine. i would give a billion stars if i could. i had condensed milk as a topping and as far as desserts go, this combination cannot be beat. the guys at the truck were incredible again and offered me an extra topping for free :) FROZEN KUHSTERD, I WILL LOVE YOU 'TIL THE END OF TIME (as lana del rey sings)...
author: Annie L.

description: tried the black sesame and avocado........all I can say is, yummy yummy for my tummy =) LIKE
author: Christine E.

description: frozen what?  jason's kuhsterd is on point!  kuhsterd is so smooth, not too sweet.  the density is perfect!!  who doesn't like cereal milk?!!  it's awesome by itself or it's great with cobbler.  you will want more than 2 scoop, trust me!  if you haven't tried their stuff, "friend" them on facebook and find out their whereabouts and also what new flavors they have in store for you!
author: Simone F.

description: INCREDIBLE. PERFECT. DELICIOUS. PERSONAL. I hired these guys for my wedding rehearsal dinner. They showed up on time, set up a gorgeous dessert station, served incredible delicious desserts. Commissioned insane cookies. (We got red velvet and bourbon choc chip cookies and fresh white mint and cinnamon toast crunch cereal milk custard!)--The ice-cream sandwiches were an incredible hit among my guests. I recommend these guys whole-heartedly. I was so happy to support a small local business--trust me, these guys won't disappoint!
author: Lauren Q.

description: I've been a loyal fan of Frozen Kuhsterd for a while now. And I cannot remember the specific event, but the one sundae that popped my FK cherry was the boba sundae and that's with Thai tea custard, condensed milk, and obviously boba. I'm very picky with desserts, but it was love at first bite. To be honest, it's a bad idea for me to have custard in the first place since I'm lactose intolerant. BUT I cannot and won't stop. It's so worth it even while I'm racing and hoping I make it to the bathroom afterwards. Anyways I've had the pleasure of trying all the other flavors by now and I absolutely love the basil strawberry custard and the Thai Tea is a close second. Try it if they have it. It's super refreshing and not too sweet! & if that doesn't tickle your fancy, just ask the employees of FK. They know best when it comes down to what will satisfy your needs. I'd definitely say that FK has earned its way to my heart through my stomach. I love this truck so much that I always try to make it a point to visit when it's around
author: Kaleena N.

description: I have never had frozen custard until i tried the cereal milk at the Metreon, instantly, i was a fan. I've tried a few of their other flavors and my favorites are salted caramel with coffee swirl, cereal milk and the cinnamon toast crunch. If you like bi-rite and Humphrey slocommbe, Frozen Kuhsterd is defiitnely comparable, if not better :) I read the other reviews and cant wait to try the four barrel coffee flavor. If you havent tried frozen khusterd yet, you are definitely missing out.
author: Carla P.
